99.Safi Kaskas 2024: Had your Lord so willed, all the people on Earth would have believed. All of them with no exception. Is it, then, up to you [Prophet] to compel People to believe?

100.Safi Kaskas 2024: No soul can ever believe except with God’s permission, and He brings disgrace on those who will not use their reason.

101.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “Look at what there is in the heavens and on Earth.” But signs and warnings will not help the people who will not believe.

102.Safi Kaskas 2024: What are they waiting for other than the punishment which came to those before them? Say, “Wait, then, and I will be waiting with you.”

103.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then We will save Our Messengers and those who believe. It is incumbent upon us to save the believers

104.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “People, if you are in doubt as to what my faith is, then [know that] I do not worship those you worship besides God, but I worship God alone, Who will eventually retrieve you back to Him, and I am commanded to be among the believers.”

105.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Prophet,] set your face towards this faith, as a man inclined to the truth. Do not be among those who violate God’s unity.

106.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not call on any besides God who can neither benefit you nor harm you. If you do it, you will be among the unjust.

107.Safi Kaskas 2024: If God inflicts harm on you, no one can remove it except for Him, and if He intends good for you, no one can turn away His favor. He grants His bounty to any of His worshipers whom He wills. He alone is truly forgiving, the Mercy Giver.

108.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “People, the Truth has come to you from your Lord. Whoever chooses to follow the path of guidance follows it for his own good, and whoever chooses to go astray does so to his personal loss. I am not responsible for your conduct.

109.Safi Kaskas 2024: Follow what is being revealed to you, and be patient in hard times until God gives His judgment. He is the best of all judges.

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: Alif. Lam. Ra. [This is] a Book whose verses are perfectly constructed, then detailed directly from the Wise, the Most Expert,

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: so that you may worship no one but God. I am sent to you from Him to warn you and to give you good news.

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: Ask your Lord to forgive your sins and turn towards Him in repentance. He will let you enjoy a good life until a specified time and will bestow His abundant grace on all who have virtues. But, if you turn away, I dread the suffering for you on that Mighty Day.

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: You must all return to God, as He has power over everything.

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: See how they turn away, trying to hide from Him. Even when they cover themselves with their clothes, He knows all that they conceal and what they reveal. He has full knowledge of what is in men’s hearts.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: Every living creature on Earth depends on God for sustenance, and He knows where it lives and where it dies. It is all in a clear record.

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: He created the heavens and the Earth in six days, and the throne of His majesty extended over the water. [He created this] to test which of you is best in deeds. And If you [Prophet] say, “You will be resurrected after death,” the unbelievers will answer, “This is nothing but sorcery.”

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: If We defer their suffering for a specified time, they are sure to say, “What is preventing it [from coming now]?” On the Day when it befalls them, there will be nothing to divert it from them, and they will be overwhelmed by the very thing they mocked.

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: If We let man taste some of Our mercy and then take it away from him, he will abandon all hope, forgetting all gratitude.

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: If We let him taste ease and plenty after hardship has touched him, he is sure to say, “Misfortune has gone away from me.” He becomes overjoyed and boastful.

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: Except for those who are patient in hard times and do righteous deeds: forgiveness of sins awaits them and a great reward.

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: Perhaps you are thinking about omitting part of what is being revealed to you, and you feel a tightness in your chest about it because they say, “If only a treasure were sent down to him, or an angel came with him [then we would believe].” [Prophet,] you are only a warner; it is God who is in charge of everything.

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: Or, they [may] say, “He invented it.” Say, “Produce ten invented chapters of similar merit, and call in whoever you can besides God to help you, if what you say is true.

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: But if they [whom you called] do not respond to you, then know that [this Qur’an) has been revealed with God’s knowledge and that there is no God but Him. Then will you submit to Him?”

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for those who care only for the life of this world and its bounties, We will repay [them] fully for everything they did, and they will be given nothing less.

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: But, for life to come, they will have nothing but the fire; their works will be fruitless, and their deeds futile.

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: Can they be compared to those who have clear evidence from their Lord, conveyed through [this] testimony from Him—as was the book previously revealed to Moses—to be a guide and mercy [to humanity]? Those [who understand] believe in it, whereas those parties that deny its truth are promised the fire. Do not be in any doubt about it; it is the Truth from your Lord, though most people do not believe so.

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: Who could be more unjust than he who attributes his lie to God? [Such people] will be arraigned before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, “They uttered lies about their Lord.” God’s rejection is what the unjust deserve

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: [those] who turn others away from the path of God—trying to make it crooked—and refuse to acknowledge the truth of the life to come.

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: They can never escape [their final reckoning, even if they remain unharmed] on Earth; they will never find anyone who can protect them from God. Double suffering will be imposed on them for having lost the ability to hear [the truth] and failed to see [it].

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: They have allowed themselves to be lost. All their invented gods will have deserted them.

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: Assuredly, in the life to come, they will lose the most.

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Only] those who believe and do righteous deeds and humble themselves before their Lord are destined for Heaven, where they will remain for eternity.

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: These two groups are like the blind and deaf in comparison to those who see and hear. Can they be alike? How can you not pay attention?

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: [In like manner], We sent Noah to his people, [saying], “I come to you with the clear warning

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: that you may worship no one but God. I fear that you may suffer on a painful Day.”

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: The notables among his people who denied the truth said, “We do not see anything in you but a mortal man like ourselves, and it is clear to see that only the worst among us follow you. We do not see that you could be superior to us in any way. On the contrary, we think you are a liar.”

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Noah] said, “My people, have you considered that I might have a clear sign from my Lord and that He has given me mercy from himself, but you fail to see? Should we then compel you to accept it against your will?

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: My people, I ask you no reward for it. My reward rests with none but God. I will not chase away the faithful. They know they are destined to meet their Lord, and I can see that you are foolish.

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: People, who could protect me from God if I chased [the faithful] away? Will you not take heed?

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: I do not say to you, ‘God’s treasures are with me,’ nor [do I say] ‘I know what is hidden,’ nor do I say, ‘I am an angel,’ nor do I say of those you hold in contempt, ‘God will not grant them any good.’ God is fully aware of what is in their hearts. If I did this, I would be among the unjust.”

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The notables] said, “Noah, you have argued with us for too long. Bring down on us the punishment with which you threaten us if you are a man of truth.”

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: He answered, “Only God will bring it upon you if He so wills, and you will not escape it.

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: My advice will be no use to you if God wills that you remain lost in your delusions. He is your Lord, and to Him, you must return.”

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: Or do they [the idolaters] say he has invented this [story]?” Say [Muhammad] “If I have invented it, I am responsible for my crime, but I am innocent of the crime of which you are guilty.”

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: It was revealed to Noah, “None of your people will believe other than those who have already done so. Do not be distressed by anything that they may do.

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: Build the Ark under Our observation and Our inspiration, and do not appeal to Me on behalf of the transgressors. They are destined to be drowned.”

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Noah] began to build the Ark, and every time the notables of his people passed by him, they mocked him. He said, “If you are mocking us now, we will come to mock you [and your ignorance] just as you are mocking us.

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: In time you will know who will receive a humiliating punishment and on whom lasting suffering will descend.”

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: When Our judgment came, and waters gushed up, We said, “Place onboard this [Ark] a pair of each species, as well as your family—except those against whom the sentence has already been passed—and the Believers,” though only a few [of Noah’s people] shared his faith.

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said [to his followers], “Board this Ark. In the name of God, it will sail and anchor. My Lord is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.”

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: It sailed with them on waves that were like mountains. Noah cried out to his son, who stayed behind, “Come aboard with us, my son, and do not stay with the unbelievers.”

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The son] answered, “I will take myself to a mountain that will protect me from the waters.” [Noah] said, “Today there is no protection [for anyone] from God’s judgment, except [for) those who have earned [His] mercy.” A wave rose between them, and [the son] was among those who drowned.

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then it was said [by God], “Earth, swallow up your water, and sky, stop [your rain].” The waters sank into the Earth, God’s will was done, and the ark came to rest on Mount Judi. It was said [by God], “Away with those evildoing folk.”

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: Noah called out to his Lord and said, “My Lord, my son was my family; Your promise always comes true, and You are the most just of all judges.”

46.Safi Kaskas 2024: [God] answered, “Noah, he was not your family, because he was unrighteous in his conduct. Do not ask me for things about which you know nothing. I am warning you not to be foolish.”

47.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Noah] said, “My Lord, I seek refuge with You from ever [again] asking You anything about which I know nothing. Unless You forgive me and have mercy on me, I will be among the lost.”

48.Safi Kaskas 2024: [God said] “Noah, descend in peace from Us and blessings on you as well as on some of the nations who are with you. [But as for] others, We will allow them to enjoy life [for a little while], and then a painful punishment from Us will afflict them.”

49.Safi Kaskas 2024: These accounts are part of what was beyond your knowledge [Muhammad]. We revealed them to you. Neither you nor your people knew them, so be patient [like Noah] in hard times. The future belongs to those who are mindful of God.

50.Safi Kaskas 2024: To ‘Ad, We sent their brother, Hud. He said, “My people worship God [alone]. You have no God other than Him. You are making up lies.

51.Safi Kaskas 2024: I ask no reward from you. My reward rests only with Him, who created me. Why don’t you use your common sense?

52.Safi Kaskas 2024: My people, ask your Lord to forgive your sins, and then turn towards Him in repentance. He will shower you with abundant heavenly grace and will add strength to your strength. Do not turn away and be lost in sin.”

53.Safi Kaskas 2024: They replied, “Hud, you have brought us no clear evidence [that you are a prophet], and we are not going to forsake our gods on the strength of your word alone, nor do we believe in you.

54.Safi Kaskas 2024: All we can say is that one of our gods has inflicted some harm to you.” [Hud] answered, “I call God to witness, and you too are my witnesses, that I disown those to whom you ascribe divinity,

55.Safi Kaskas 2024: except for God. Plot [anything that you may wish] against me, and give me no respite.

56.Safi Kaskas 2024: I have placed my trust in God, [who is] my Lord and your Lord. There is no living creature that He does not control. My Lord’s way is a straight path.”

57.Safi Kaskas 2024: But if they turn away, then say, “I have delivered to you the messages with which I have been sent. My Lord will bring along other people to take your place, whereas you will in no way harm Him. My lord watches over all things.”

58.Safi Kaskas 2024: When Our judgment came, We saved Hud and those who believed with him through a Mercy from Us; and We saved them from a grave punishment.

59.Safi Kaskas 2024: That was [the end of ‘Ad, [who] rejected their Lord’s messages, and disobeyed His Messengers, and followed the command of every arrogant enemy of the truth.

60.Safi Kaskas 2024: A curse will follow them in this world, and so will they be cursed on the Day of Resurrection. ‘Ad denied their Lord. So away with ‘Ad, the people of Hud.

61.Safi Kaskas 2024: To the people of Thamud, We sent their brother Salih. He said, “My people, worship God [alone]. You have no God other than Him. He created you out of the Earth and made you inhabit it. Ask Him to forgive your sins, and turn towards Him in repentance. My Lord is near and ready to answer [whoever calls to Him].”

62.Safi Kaskas 2024: They answered, “Salih, We used to have such great hopes in you. Would you forbid us to worship what our forefathers worshipped? We are in grave doubt, amounting to suspicion, about what you are asking us to do.”

63.Safi Kaskas 2024: He retorted, “My people, just think, if I am taking my stand based on clear evidence from my Lord and if He had given me mercy from Himself, who could protect me from God if I disobeyed Him? You would only make my loss greater.

64.Safi Kaskas 2024: My people, this camel belongs to God; it will be a sign for you. Leave it to pasture on God’s land and do her no harm, or you will soon be punished.”

65.Safi Kaskas 2024: However, they cruelly slaughtered her. [Salih] said, “You will enjoy living in your homes for only three [more] days; this is a judgment which will not prove false.”

66.Safi Kaskas 2024: When Our command came, We saved Salih and those who believed with him as a mercy from Us, and [We saved them] from the disgrace of that Day. Your Lord alone is the All-powerful, Revered.

67.Safi Kaskas 2024: The blast [of God’s punishment] overtook the evildoers, and they lay lifeless in their homes and on the ground

68.Safi Kaskas 2024: as though they had never lived there. Thamud denied their Lord, so away with Thamud.

69.Safi Kaskas 2024: To Abraham, Our [heavenly] Messengers brought good news. They said, “Peace,” and he answered, “[And upon you be] peace.” Without delay, he placed a roasted calf before them.

70.Safi Kaskas 2024: When he saw that their hands did not reach out towards it, he found this strange and became apprehensive of them. They said, “Do not fear. We are sent against the people of Lot.”

71.Safi Kaskas 2024: His wife, standing [nearby], laughed [with happiness]. We gave her the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, and, after Isaac, of [Isaac’s son] Jacob.

72.Safi Kaskas 2024: She said, “Alas for me. How am I to bear a child when I am an old woman, and this husband of mine is an older man? That would be an astonishing thing.”

73.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The Messengers] said, “Are you astonished at God’s command? May the mercy of God and His blessing be upon you, people of this house. He is worthy of all praise and Glory.”

74.Safi Kaskas 2024: When the fear left Abraham, and the good news had been conveyed to him, he began to plead with Us for Lot’s people.

75.Safi Kaskas 2024: Abraham was forbearing, tender-hearted, and devout.

76.Safi Kaskas 2024: [God’s Messengers replied,] “Abraham, stop this [pleading]. Your Lord’s judgment has already passed. Punishment is coming to them, which cannot be turned back.”

77.Safi Kaskas 2024: When Our Messengers came to Lot, he was sad for [his people], seeing that it was beyond his power to protect them, and he said, “This is a truly terrible day.”

78.Safi Kaskas 2024: His people came running to him; they were accustomed to committing foul deeds. [Lot] said, “My people, take my daughters instead. They are purer for you [than men]. Fear God, and do not disgrace me with my guests. Is there not a single right-minded man among you?

79.Safi Kaskas 2024: ” They answered, “You have always known that we have no right to your daughters. You know very well what we want.”

80.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Lot] exclaimed, “If only I had the strength to defeat you or could rely on mightier support.”

81.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The angels] said, “Lot, we are Messengers from your Lord. [Your enemies] will never reach you. Leave with your household in the dead of night, and do not look back. [Take all of your family with you] except for your wife. The fate which will befall [the people of Sodom] will befall her [as well]. Their appointed time is the morning. Is not the morning near?”

82.Safi Kaskas 2024: When Our judgment came about, We turned those [sinful towns] upside down and rained down on them stones of hard clay, layer after layer, [which were]

83.Safi Kaskas 2024: designated by your Lord [to punish sinners]. [Such punishment] is never far from the unjust.

84.Safi Kaskas 2024: To [the people of] Midian [We sent] their brother Shu’ayb. He said, “My people, worship God [alone]. You have no God other than Him. Do not give [false] measure or weight [in your dealings with people]. I see that you are prospering, but I fear for your suffering on a day that will encompass you [with doom].

85.Safi Kaskas 2024: Hence, my people, [always] give full measure and weight, with equity, and do not deprive people of what is rightfully theirs, and do not act wickedly on Earth by spreading corruption.

86.Safi Kaskas 2024: What rests with God is best for you if you are believers. I am not your keeper.”

87.Safi Kaskas 2024: They said, “Shu’ayb, does your prayer command you that we give up what our forefathers worshipped or to refrain from doing with our wealth whatever we please? You certainly sound like the perfect tolerant and right-minded man!”

88.Safi Kaskas 2024: He answered, “My people, what if I am acting on clear evidence from my Lord, and He has given me good provision? I have no desire to differ from you concerning what I have forbidden you. I want no more than to set things right as much as I can. I cannot succeed without God’s help. I have placed my trust in Him, and I always turn to Him.

89.Safi Kaskas 2024: My people, do not let [your] disagreement with me drive you into sin and bring upon you a fate similar to that of the people of Noah or Hud or Salih, and [remember that] the people of Lot did not live very far from you.

90.Safi Kaskas 2024: Ask your Lord to forgive your sins, and then turn towards Him in repentance. My Lord is the Mercy-Giver and Most-Loving.”

91.Safi Kaskas 2024: [His people] said, “Shu’ayb, We cannot understand much of what you say. We find you weak [and poorly connected] among us, and, were it not for your clan, we would have stoned you to death, considering that you have no status among us.”

92.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, “My people, do you hold my clan in greater esteem than God, that you turned your backs on Him? My Lord is fully aware of all that you do.

93.Safi Kaskas 2024: Hence, do what you think is best, and I will do what I think is best. In time you will certainly know who will receive a punishment to disgrace him and who is a liar. Watch [for what is coming]. I will watch it with you.”

94.Safi Kaskas 2024: When Our judgment came, We saved Shu’ayb and those who believed with him, by Our mercy, while the blast [of Our punishment] overtook those who had done wrong, and they lay lifeless in their homes

95.Safi Kaskas 2024: as though they had never lived there. Away with [the people of] Midian, as was done away with [the people of] Thamud.

96.Safi Kaskas 2024: We sent Moses with Our messages and clear authority

97.Safi Kaskas 2024: to Pharaoh and his inner circle, but they followed Pharaoh’s orders, and Pharaoh’s orders were misguided.

98.Safi Kaskas 2024: On the Day of Resurrection, he will go before his people, having led them towards the fire. Miserable is the destination to which they are led.

99.Safi Kaskas 2024: They were pursued by [God’s] rejection in this [world] and [will be overtaken by it] on the Day of Resurrection. What a rotten gift to be given.

100.Safi Kaskas 2024: These are parts of the accounts of those [ancient] communities that We are relating to you; some remain, and some are [extinct, like] a field mown down.

101.Safi Kaskas 2024: We did not wrong them; they wronged themselves. When your Lord’s judgment was ordained, those deities of theirs, which they called on instead of God, proved to be of no use to them and only increased their ruin.

102.Safi Kaskas 2024: Such is the punishment of your Lord when He decides to punish a community for their transgression. His punishment is painful and severe.

103.Safi Kaskas 2024: In that is a sign for anyone who fears the suffering [which may befall them] in the Hereafter. That is The Day on which people will be gathered together—that is a Day to be witnessed

104.Safi Kaskas 2024: [and] We will not delay beyond a specified period.

105.Safi Kaskas 2024: When that Day comes, not a soul will speak except by His permission. Some will be miserable, and some will be blessed.

106.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for those who will have brought misery upon themselves, [they will live] in the fire, moaning and groaning,

107.Safi Kaskas 2024: where they will remain as long as the heavens and the Earth endure unless your Lord wills otherwise. Your Lord is the doer of what He wills.

108.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for those who will be blessed, [they will live] in Heaven, to stay as long as the heavens and the Earth endure, unless your Lord wills otherwise—an uninterrupted blessing.

109.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Prophet], do not doubt what these [misguided people] worship. They worship as their forefathers worshipped before them, and We will certainly give them their full share [for whatever good or evil they have earned], with no reduction.

110.Safi Kaskas 2024: We gave Moses the Book before you, but they were in dispute about it. Were it not for a prior decree from your Lord; it would have been settled between them. Still, they had suspicious doubts about it [the Torah].

111.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your Lord will give everyone their full due for whatever [good or evil] they may have done. He is aware of everything they do.

112.Safi Kaskas 2024: Remain steadfast, as you have been commanded [by God], together with those with you who have turned to Him. Do not let anyone overstep the limits because He sees all that you do.

113.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not incline towards those who do evil, lest the fire touches you. You will [then] have no one to protect you from God, nor will you be helped.

114.Safi Kaskas 2024: Establish prayer at the beginning and end of the day, as well as during parts of the night. Good deeds drive away evil deeds. This is a reminder to the mindful.

115.Safi Kaskas 2024: Be patient in hard times. God does not fail to repay those who do good.

116.Safi Kaskas 2024: If only–among the generations before your time—there had been people with a good sense to speak out against corruption on Earth, [as did] the few of them whom We saved. [Instead,] the unjust only pursued pleasures that corrupted their entire beings, and that led them to sin

117.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your Lord would never destroy towns unjustly so long as their people behaved righteously [towards one another].

118.Safi Kaskas 2024: Had your Lord willed, He could have made all of the human beings one single community, but [He willed it otherwise, and so] they continue to have divergent views,

119.Safi Kaskas 2024: except those shown mercy by your Lord- To this end, He created them. The word of your Lord will be fulfilled: “I will fill Hell with both jinn and humans.”

120.Safi Kaskas 2024: So, [Prophet], We have relayed the accounts of the [earlier] messengers to you to make your heart firm. The Truth comes to you through these accounts, as well as lessons and reminders for the believers.

121.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say to those who will not believe, “Do anything that is within your power, while we labor [in God’s way]

122.Safi Kaskas 2024: and wait [for what is coming]. We are waiting too.”

123.Safi Kaskas 2024: God alone comprehends the hidden reality of the heavens and the Earth. Everything that exists goes back to Him, so worship Him and place your trust in Him alone. Your Lord is never unaware of what you [people] are doing.

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: Alif Lam Ra, these are the verses of the awe-inspiringly clear Book.

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur’an so that you might understand it.

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: We tell you the best of stories in what We have revealed to you of this Qur’an, seeing that you were among those who were unaware.

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: Joseph said to his father, “Father, I saw [in a dream] eleven stars, as well as the sun and the moon. I saw them bow before me.”

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Jacob] replied, “My son, do not tell your brothers your dream, or they may plot to harm you [out of envy]. Satan is man’s open enemy.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: And thus Your Lord will choose you, and will teach you to interpret some events, and will perfect His grace on you and on the House of Jacob, just as He perfected it earlier upon your forefathers Abraham and Isaac. Your Lord is All-Knowing, All-Wise.”

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: In [the story of] Joseph and his brothers, there are messages for all who search [for the truth].

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Joseph’s brothers] said [to one another], “Joseph and his brother [Benjamin] are dearer to our father than we are, even though we are so many. Our father is clearly wrong.”

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: [One of them said]“Kill Joseph or drive him away to some [faraway] land, so that your father’s attention will be free to turn to you. After this is done, you will be [free to repent and to live once again as] righteous people.”

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: Another of them said, “Do not kill Joseph. If you must do something, throw him into the dark depths of this well, where some caravan may pick him up.”

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: [They agreed on this course, and] they spoke [to Jacob], “Father, why don’t you trust us with Joseph, seeing as we wish him well?

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: Let him go out with us tomorrow so that he may play and enjoy himself, and We will protect him well.”

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Jacob] said, “The thought of you taking him away with you worries me. I am afraid a wolf may eat him at a moment when you are not paying attention.”

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: They said, “If the wolf were to devour him when there are so many of us, we would be the real losers.

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: When they went away with him and decided to throw him into the dark depths of a well, We inspired him, saying, “One day, you will remind them of their deed at a time when they will least expect it.”

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: At nightfall, they returned to their father, weeping,

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: [and] said, “Father, we were racing with one another and left Joseph behind with our things, and a wolf devoured him. [We know that] you will not believe us even though we are telling the truth,”

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: and they produced his shirt deceptively stained with blood. [Jacob] exclaimed, “Rather your souls have enticed you to something. But patience is beautiful, and it is to God [alone] that I pray for strength to cope with what you are saying to me.”

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: A caravan came, and they sent someone to draw water. He sent down his bucket into the well, [and, when he saw Joseph] he said, “Good news, there is a boy.” They hid him with the intention of selling him, but God had full knowledge of everything that they were doing.

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: They sold him for a small price—a few pieces of silver—so little did they value him.

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: The man from Egypt who bought him said to his wife, “Look after him well. He may be useful to us, or we may adopt him as a son.” In this way, We gave Joseph a firm place on Earth, and [We did this] so that We could teach him the inner meaning of things. God always prevails in His purpose, but most people do not know this.

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: When he reached full manhood, We gave him the ability to judge [between right and wrong], as well as knowledge; thus, We reward those who do good.

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: The woman in whose house he was living tried to seduce him; she bolted the doors and said, “Come to me.” [Joseph] answered, “God forbid! My master has been good to me. No good can come of [such a] wrong.”

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: She desired him, and he desired her [, and he would have succumbed] had he not seen evidence of his Lord’s truth. We did this in order to keep evil and indecency away from him. He was truly one of Our chosen worshipers.

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: They both rushed to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and, at the door, they met her husband. She said, “What, other than prison or painful punishment, should be the reward of someone who tried to dishonor your wife?”

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Joseph] said, “It was she who tried to seduce me.” A member of her household suggested that “If his shirt has been torn from the front, then she is telling the truth and he is a liar,

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: but if his shirt has been torn from behind, then she is lying, and he is telling the truth.”

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: When [her husband] saw that his shirt was torn from behind, he said, “This is another instance of women’s treachery. Your treachery is truly great.

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: Joseph, overlook this. While you, [wife,] ask forgiveness for your transgression—you are greatly at fault.”

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: Some women of the town said [to one another], “The governor’s wife is trying to seduce her servant . Her love for him consumes her. We see that she is clearly lost.”

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: When she heard about their gossip, she sent for them, and prepared a banquet for them, and handed each of them a knife. She said [to Joseph], “Come out before them.” When the women saw him, they were awestruck [by his beauty] and [so flustered that] they cut their hands [with their knives], saying, “God save us. This is not a mortal man. He must be a precious angel.”

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: She said, “Here is the one you blamed me for. I sought to seduce him, but he firmly refused. Now, if he does not do what I order, he will be put in prison and will be humiliated.”

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, “Lord, prison is more desirable to me than what these women are inviting me to do. If you do not protect me from their treachery, I might yield to their allure and so become one of the ignorant.”

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: His Lord responded to his prayer and protected him from their treachery. He alone is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: It occurred to the governor and his household after they had seen all the signs [of Joseph’s innocence] that they should imprison him for a while.

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: Two young men happened to go to prison at the same time as Joseph. One of them said, “I saw myself [in a dream] pressing wine.” The other said, “I saw myself [in a dream] carrying bread on my head, and birds were eating it.” (They said to Joseph,] “Tell us the real meaning of this. We see that you are a knowledgeable man.”

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Joseph] answered, “I will inform you of the interpreted meaning of your dreams before your meal arrives, for this is [part] of the knowledge which my Lord has taught me. I have left behind the way of people who do not believe in God and who persistently deny the truth of the life to come,

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: and I follow the faith of my forefathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. It is not conceivable that we should ascribe divinity [to anything] besides God. Such is God’s grace to us and all humanity, but most people are ungrateful.

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: Fellow prisoners, which is more reasonable: [belief in the existence of numerous divine] lords that are different from one another, or [in] the One God, who holds absolute power over all that exists? [12:39)

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: All that you worship instead of God is nothing but [empty] names which you and your forefathers have invented, names for which God has sent down no authority. Judgment [as to what is right and what is wrong] rests with God alone, [and] He has ordered that you worship none but Him. This is true faith, though most people do not realize it.

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: Fellow prisoners, [I will tell you the meaning of your dreams.] One of you will serve his master with wine to drink, but the other will be crucified, and birds will eat off of his head. [Whatever your future holds,] the matter on which you asked my opinion has been decided [by God].”

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Joseph] said to the one he knew would be saved, “Mention me to your master [when you are free],” but Satan caused him to forget to mention [Joseph] to his master, and so he remained in prison for a few [more] years.

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: [One day] the King said, “I saw [in a dream] seven fat cows being devoured by seven [that were] lean; and seven green spikes [of grain] and [seven] others that were dry. Noblemen, enlighten me about [the meaning of] my dream if you are able to interpret dreams.” They answered

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: “These are confusing dreams, and we have no deep knowledge of dream interpretation.”

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: The prisoner who had been saved [suddenly] remembered [Joseph] after all that time and said, “I can inform you of the real meaning of this [dream], so send me forth.”

46.Safi Kaskas 2024: [He went to see Joseph in prison and said to him], “Truthful, Joseph. Enlighten us about [the meaning of a dream in which] seven fat cows were being devoured by seven [that were] lean, and seven green spikes [of grain] and [seven] others that were dry, so that I may return [with your explanation] to the people [who sent me, and] inform them.”

47.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Joseph] replied, “You will sow for seven years as usual, but let all [the grain] that you harvest remain [untouched] in its spikes, except for a little that you may eat.

48.Safi Kaskas 2024: For, after that [period of seven good years], there will be seven years of hardship, which will consume all but a little of what you stored up for them.

49.Safi Kaskas 2024: After that will come a year in which the people will have abundant rain and will press grapes.”

50.Safi Kaskas 2024: [As soon as Joseph’s interpretation was conveyed to him,] the King said, “Bring him before me.” When the [King’s] messenger came to him, [Joseph] said, “Go back to your master and ask him [first to find out the truth] about those women who cut their hands—my Lord knows all about their treachery.”

51.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The King sent for the women, and, when they came,] he asked, “What was it that you hoped to achieve when you tried to seduce Joseph?” The women answered, “God save us. We know nothing bad of him.” The governor’s wife [Joseph’s former master] said, “Now the truth is out. It was I who tried to seduce him. He is an honest man.”

52.Safi Kaskas 2024: [When Joseph learned what had happened, he said, “I asked for] this so that [my former master] can know that I did not betray him behind his back. God does not guide the mischief of the treacherous.

53.Safi Kaskas 2024: I am not trying to absolve myself, for indeed the soul is ever inclined to evil, except those shown mercy by my Lord. My Lord is the Most Forgiving, the Mercy Giver.”

54.Safi Kaskas 2024: The King said, “Bring him to me. I will have him serve me personally.” When he had spoken with him, [the King] said, “[From] now on you will have our trust and favor.”

55.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Joseph] replied, “Put me in charge of the nation’s store-houses. I will be a knowledgeable keeper.”

56.Safi Kaskas 2024: We established Joseph securely in that land to live wherever he wished. We grant Our grace to whomever We will, and We do not fail to reward those who do good.

57.Safi Kaskas 2024: In the eyes of those who believe and have always been mindful of Us, a reward in the life to come is a far greater good [than any reward in this world].

58.Safi Kaskas 2024: [After some years], Joseph’s brothers came [to Egypt] and presented themselves before him, and he knew them [at once], but they did not recognize him.

59.Safi Kaskas 2024: When he had provided them with their provisions, he said, “[When you come here next,] bring me the brother of yours from your father’s side. Have you not seen me giving generous measure and being the best of hosts?

60.Safi Kaskas 2024: If you do not bring him to me, you will never again receive a single measure [of grain] from me, nor will you [be allowed to] come near me.”

61.Safi Kaskas 2024: They answered, “We will try to persuade his father to part with him, and We will do [our best].”

62.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Joseph] said to his servants, “Place their merchandise in their camel-packs, so that they may recognize them when they go back to their family, and be eager to return.

63.Safi Kaskas 2024: When they returned to their father, [Joseph’s brothers] said, “Father, all the grain will be withheld from us [in the future unless we bring Benjamin with us]. Send our brother with us, so that we may be given another measure. We will guard him carefully.”

64.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Jacob] replied, “Will I trust you with him in the same way I trusted you with his brother [Joseph] before? No, but God’s guardianship is better [than yours]. He is the Most Merciful to those who show mercy.”

65.Safi Kaskas 2024: When they opened their packs, they discovered that their merchandise had been returned to them, [and] they said, “Father, what more could we desire? Here is our merchandise; it has been returned to us. [If you send Benjamin with us,] We will [again] be able to bring food for our family, and will guard our brother [well], and receive an additional camel-load of grain—an extra measure so easily achieved.”

66.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Jacob] said, “I will not send him with you until you give me a solemn pledge, before God, that you will bring him back to me unless you are overwhelmed [by enemies].” When they gave him their solemn pledge, [Jacob] said, “God is witness to everything we say.”

67.Safi Kaskas 2024: He added, “My sons, do not enter [the town] through one gate, but enter through different gates. I cannot help you against the will of God. Judgment [as to what is to happen] rests with none but God. I have placed my trust in Him. Everyone who has trust [in His existence] must place their trust in Him alone.”

68.Safi Kaskas 2024: Although they entered [the town] in the way their father had told them, it did not help them against the will of God. It merely satisfied a wish of Jacob’s [to protect them]. He knew well what We had taught him, though most people do not.

69.Safi Kaskas 2024: When [the sons of Jacob] presented themselves before Joseph, he drew his brother [Benjamin] to himself, saying [to him in secret], “I am your brother, so do not be saddened by their past actions.”

70.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Later,] when he had provided them with their provisions, he placed the [king’s] drinking-cup in his brother’s camel-pack. As [they were leaving the town,] a watchman called out, “People of the caravan, you are thieves.”

71.Safi Kaskas 2024: Turning towards the man and his companions, [the brothers] asked, “What are you missing?”

72.Safi Kaskas 2024: They answered, “We are missing the king’s cup, and he who produces it will receive a camel-load [of grain as a reward]. I [Joseph) pledge myself to this.”

73.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The brothers] said, “By God, you must know that we have not come to commit corrupt deeds in this land and that we have not been stealing.”

74.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The Egyptians] said, “What will be the penalty for this [deed] if you are [proved to be] liars?”

75.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The brothers] replied, “The penalty will be [the enslavement of] the person in whose bag the cup is found: this is how we punish wrongdoers.”

76.Safi Kaskas 2024: [They were brought before Joseph to be searched, and] he began with the bags of his half-brothers before the bag of his brother [Benjamin]. In the end, he produced the drinking cup from his brother’s bag. In this way, We schemed on Joseph’s behalf—if God had not so willed, he could not have detained his brother as a penalty under the king’s law. We raise the rank of whoever We will, but above everyone who is endowed with knowledge, there is One who knows everything.

77.Safi Kaskas 2024: [As soon as the cup was produced from Benjamin’s bag, the brothers] said, “If he is a thief, then his brother was a thief before him.” Joseph said to himself, without revealing his thought to them, “You are far worse in this respect, and God is fully aware of what you are saying.”

78.Safi Kaskas 2024: They said, “Honorable governor, he has a father who is a very old man. Therefore, detain one of us instead. We can see that you are a very good man.”

79.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Joseph] answered, “May God preserve us from [the sin of] detaining anyone other than the person on whom we found our property; that would be unjust of us.”

80.Safi Kaskas 2024: When they lost all hope of [persuading] him, they withdrew to take counsel [among themselves]. The eldest of them said, “Do not you remember that your father took a solemn pledge from you before God, and how before that you failed with regards to Joseph? I will not depart from this land until my father gives me leave or God passes judgment in my favor. He is the best of all judges.

81.Safi Kaskas 2024: [As for you others,] return to your father and say, “Father, your son has stolen [the king’s cup]. We can tell you only what we saw. How could we guard against the unforeseen?

82.Safi Kaskas 2024: Ask in the town we were in [at the time], and the people of the caravan that we traveled with, and [you will find that] we are telling the truth.”

83.Safi Kaskas 2024: [When they returned to their father and told him what had happened], he said, “No, your souls have enticed you to such a [terrible] thing. [As for me], patience in hard times is most godly. Perhaps God will bring them all [back] to me. He alone is All-Knowing, All-Wise.”

84.Safi Kaskas 2024: He turned away from them and said, “Alas for Joseph,” and his eyes clouded over with grief, and he was filled with sorrow.

85.Safi Kaskas 2024: [His sons] said, “By God. You will never stop remembering Joseph until you are broken, or are dead.”

86.Safi Kaskas 2024: He answered, “It is only to God that I complain of my deep grief and sorrow. I know from God something that you do not know.

87.Safi Kaskas 2024: My sons, go and try to obtain some news of Joseph and his brother, and do not lose hope of God’s essence (of loving mercy). Only the unbelievers lose hope of God’s essence (life-giving mercy).”

88.Safi Kaskas 2024: When they presented themselves before him, they said, “Honorable governor, our family and we have been afflicted with hardship, and we have brought only a little merchandise, but give us full measure [of grain] and be charitable to us. God rewards the charitable.”

89.Safi Kaskas 2024: He replied, “Do you remember what you did to Joseph and his brother when you were still ignorant?”

90.Safi Kaskas 2024: They said, “Could it be that you are Joseph?” He said, “I am Joseph, and this is my brother. God has been gracious to us. If one is mindful of Him and patient in hard times, God does not allow the reward of those who do good to be lost.”

91.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The brothers] said, “By God. God has certainly raised you above us, and we were sinners.”

92.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, “No blame will be uttered today against you. May God forgive you for your sins. He is the Most Merciful of those who are merciful.

93.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Now] take this shirt of mine and lay it over my father’s face, and he will recover his sight. Then come [back] to me with all of your family.”

94.Safi Kaskas 2024: As soon as the caravan [with which Jacob’s sons were traveling] was on its way, their father said [to the people around him], “You may think I am senile, but I can smell Joseph.”

95.Safi Kaskas 2024: They answered, “By God, you are still lost in that old illusion of yours.”

96.Safi Kaskas 2024: But when the bearer of good news came [with Joseph’s shirt], he laid it over his face, and he regained his sight, and said, “Did I not tell you, ‘I know, from God, something that you do not know’?”

97.Safi Kaskas 2024: [His sons] answered, “Father, ask God to forgive us our transgressions. We were transgressors.”

98.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, “I will ask my Lord to forgive you. He alone is truly forgiving, the Mercy Giver.”

99.Safi Kaskas 2024: When they [arrived in Egypt and] presented themselves before Joseph, he drew his parent to him, saying, “Enter Egypt. If God's wills, you will be secure.”

100.Safi Kaskas 2024: He raised his parents to the highest place of honor, and they [all] fell before him, bowing. [Joseph] said, “My father, this is the real meaning of my dream long ago, which my Lord has made come true. He was good to me when He freed me from the prison, and [when] He brought you [all to me] from the desert after Satan sowed discord between my brothers and I. My Lord is most subtle in achieving whatever He wills. He alone is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

101.Safi Kaskas 2024: My Lord, you have given me power and have imparted to me some knowledge about the interpretation of dreams. ‘O’ Originator of heavens and Earth, You are my protector in this world and in the life to come. Let me die as one who has surrendered himself to You and allow me to join the righteous.”

102.Safi Kaskas 2024: We now reveal to you this account of something that was beyond your knowledge. You were not with Joseph’s brothers when they decided what they were going to do and schemed [against him].

103.Safi Kaskas 2024: However eager you may be, most people will not believe [in this revelation],

104.Safi Kaskas 2024: although you do not ask them for any reward for [reciting] it. It is [God’s] reminder to all people.

105.Safi Kaskas 2024: How many signs are there in heavens and on Earth which they pass by and on which they turn their backs?

106.Safi Kaskas 2024: Most of them do not even believe in God without associating others with Him.

107.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do they have assurances that the all-enveloping punishment of God’s will evade them or that the Last Hour will not come upon them suddenly when they least expect it?

108.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Prophet], Say, “This is my way: I and all who follow me call [people] to God based on the clear insight. May God be exalted in His glory! I am not one of those who associate others with Him.”

109.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Even] before your time, We never sent [as Our Messengers] anyone except [mortal] men, whom We inspired, [and whom We always chose] from among the people of the [very] communities [to whom the message was to be brought]. Have the [unbelievers] not traveled through the land and seen the end of those who went before them? Those who are mindful of God prefer life to come. Do you [people] not use your reason?

110.Safi Kaskas 2024: [All the earlier messengers had to suffer persecution for a long time,] but, at last, when those messengers had lost all hope and saw themselves branded as liars, Our help came to them. We saved whomever. We are pleased, but Our punishment will not be turned away from those who force others to reject God’s messages.

111.Safi Kaskas 2024: In the stories of these men, there is a lesson for those who understand. [As for this Book], it could not possibly be a discourse invented [by the Prophet]. No, it is a confirmation of what is available to him from prior revelations, clearly spelling out everything and [offering] guidance and mercy to people who will believe.

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: Alif Lam Meem Ra, these are the verses of the Book, and what has been sent down to you from your Lord is the Truth, yet most people will not believe.

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is God Who has raised the heavens without any visible support , and He then settled on the Throne of His majesty. He has made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each ordained by Him, to run its course for an appointed time. He governs everything that exists. He clearly explains these signs so that you may become certain that you are destined to meet your Lord [on Judgment Day].

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: He has spread the Earth wide, placed firm mountains and running waters on it, and created two of every kind of fruit, [and He] causes the night to cover the day. Surely there are signs in all of this for people to contemplate.

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: There are, on Earth, neighboring plots, gardens of vineyards, crops, date palm trees sharing the same root, or alone. They are all watered with the same water, yet We make some better tasting than others. Surely there are signs in all of this for people who use their reason

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: And if you are astonished [at God’s creation], then it is [equally] astonishing to hear them [doubters] say, "Once we are dust, will we [really] be created anew?" These are the ones who have denied the truth about their Lord and who will have shackles around their necks and are in the fire, where they will reside eternally.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: They [the unbelievers] challenge you [Prophet] to hasten the evil [in preference to] good, even though [they should know that] examples of punishments have [readily] occurred before. Your Lord is full of forgiveness for people despite their wrongdoing; nonetheless, your Lord is [also] severe in retribution.

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: And the unbelievers say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" You [Prophet] are there only to give warning, and for every people, there has been a guide.

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: God knows what every female bear and whether the wombs fall short or whether they exceed . Everything with Him is in due proportion. And everything with Him has a due measure.

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: [He is) Knower of all that is beyond human's perception, as well as all that can be witnessed by humans, the Grand, the Exalted.

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is the same [to Him] whether one among you will conceal [his] speech or speak openly and whether one is hidden by night or conspicuous [among others] by day.

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: Each [person] has [angels arrayed] before and behind him to protect him by God’s command. God does not change the condition of a people unless they change what is in themselves. And when God intends ill for a people, there is no avoiding it. Apart from Him, they have no protector.

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is He Who shows you lightning, [causing] fear and hope, and [Who] generates the heavy clouds.

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: The thunder glorifies and praises Him—as do the angels—in awe of Him. He sends thunderbolts and with them strikes whom He wills. Yet, they stubbornly argue about God, while He alone has the power to do whatever He wills.

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: True prayer is to Him alone, and those who call upon anyone besides Him receive no response. [They are] like one who stretches his hands toward water hoping for it to reach his mouth, but it will not reach him. And the prayers of the unbelievers are simply lost.

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: Everything in heaven and on Earth submits to God, willingly or unwillingly, as do their shadows in the mornings and the evenings.

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, "Who is Lord of the heavens and Earth?" Say, "God." Say, "Why do you then take protectors besides Him, who can neither benefit nor harm even themselves?" Say, “Are the blind the same as those who see? Or is ignorance equivalent to enlightenment?” Or, do they assign to God partners who produced a creation like His, leaving them confused between the two creations? Say, "God is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the All-Compelling."

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: He sends rain down from the sky, and watercourses flow according to their capacity, and the torrent carries rising foam—like the foam that appears when people melt metal with fire to make ornaments or utensils. Thus God depicts Truth and falsehood. As for the foam, it vanishes, [being] cast off, but that which benefits human beings remains behind. In this way, God presents analogies.

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who respond to their Lord will [have] an excellent [reward], but those who do not respond to Him, everything on Earth and the like of it besides, would never redeem themselves with it. They have miscalculated; Hell will be their dwelling and how awful a resting place it is!.

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: Can the one who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the Truth be like one who is blind? Only those who are endowed with insight will keep this in mind.

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who fulfill their commitment to God and do not break the covenant;

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: and those who join what God has ordered to be joined, and are in awe of their Lord, and fear a dire Reckoning;

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: and those who are patient, seeking the pleasure of their Lord, and establish prayer, and spend [both] secretly and publicly from what We have provided for them, and prevent evil with good—these will have the best reward, the Ultimate [Heavenly] Home,

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: the Gardens of Eden. Which they will enter with whoever was righteous among their forefathers, their spouses, and their descendants. The angels will go to them from every gate, [saying],

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: Peace be upon you for what you patiently endured. How excellent is your Ultimate Home!

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: But those who break the covenant of God after agreeing to it, and sever that which God has ordered to be joined, and spread corruption on Earth—for them is the curse, and they will have the Worst Home [in Hell].

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: God extends or restricts sustenance to whom He wills. They rejoice in the life of this world, but it is simply a passing pleasure compared to the Hereafter.

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: And the unbelievers say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "God lets go astray him who wills as He guides to Himself whoever turns [to Him].

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of God. Truly, hearts find peace only in the remembrance of God."

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds—joy and a blessed [final] return will await them.

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: So, In the same way, We have sent you [Prophet] to a community before which other communities have come and gone, to recite to them what We have revealed to you. Yet, they still reject the Merciful to All. Say, "He is my Lord; there is no God except Him. I put my trust in Him, and to Him, I will return."

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: Even if there were a Qur’an which moved mountains or shattered the Earth or the dead made to speak [they would not believe]. God alone decides about all matters. Do the believers not know that, had God willed, He would have guided all human beings? As for the unbelievers—calamity will not cease to strike them for what they have done, nor [cease] to descend near their home[s] until the promise of God is fulfilled. God does not fail to keep His promise.

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: Messengers before you were ridiculed. I gave the unbelievers a little more time, and then I seized them. How terrible was My punishment!

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: Is He who cares for every soul, according to what It deserves [like any other?], and yet, they still associate partners to Him. Say, "Name them. Do you presume to tell Him something that He does not already know about the Earth, or is this an empty display of words?" The unbelievers’ ploy has been made to seem attractive to them, and so they have been diverted from the right path. Whomever God allows to stray, there will be no guide for him.

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: For them will be punishment in the life of [this] world, but the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe. And they will not have any protector from God.

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: The likeness of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised: rivers flow through it, [and its] fruit and shade are everlasting. Such is the reward for the righteous, and the award for the unbelievers is the Fire.

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those to whom We gave the Book rejoice at what has been sent down to you, but some of the opposing factions deny part of it. Say, "I have been commanded to worship God alone and not to associate anything with Him. To Him, I invite others, and to Him, I shall return."

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: And thus, We have revealed it as an Arabic code of law. And if you should follow [your people’s] whims and desires after knowledge has come to you, you would not have any ally or any protector from God.

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. No messenger came with a sign except by permission of God. For every time, there has been a [suitable] revelation.

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: God eliminates or confirms [His earlier revelations] [as] He wills, and with Him is the source of all revelation.

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: And whether We show you part of what We promise them [those who reject God] or cause you to die [before that time], your only responsibility is to deliver the message; and the reckoning is ours.

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: Have they not seen how We deal with the Earth, eroding it at its extremities? God decides; no one can modify His decision. He is swift in calling to account.

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: And those [who lived] before them [your people who reject God] schemed [against God’s Messengers], but the ultimate scheme belongs to God. He knows what every soul earns, and the unbelievers will soon know to whom the future belongs.

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: And those who have denied the truth say, "You are not a messenger.” Say, “God is a sufficient witness between you and me, and so is anyone else who knows the Book."

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: Alif Lam Ra, a Book which We have sent down to you so that you might, with your Lord’s permission, bring people out of dark ignorance into enlightenment, onto the path that leads to the Revered, the Praiseworthy

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: God, to Whom all that is in the heavens and all that is on Earth belongs. And woe to the unbelievers, for severe punishment

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: awaits those who love the life of this world, preferring it to the life to come. They turn others away from the path of God and make it seem irrelevant. These people have gone far astray.

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: Every messenger whom We have sent used his people’s language so that he might make [the Truth] clear to them, but God lets whoever wants to stray go astray, and guides whoever wants [to be guided]. He alone is Revered, and The Wise.

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: We sent Moses with Our messages: “Lead your people out of dark ignorance into enlightenment, and remind them of the Days of God.” In this, there are messages for all who are patient and grateful.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: Moses said to his people, “Remember the grace which God gave you when He saved you from Pharaoh’s people who afflicted you with cruel suffering, and slaughtered your sons, and spared [only] your women, which was a severe test from your Lord.

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Remember the time] when your Lord promised, “If you are grateful, I will certainly give you more and more, but if you are ungrateful, My punishment will be severe.”

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: Moses added, “[Even] if you, and whoever else lives on Earth, [ever] deny the truth, God is rich beyond need, worthy of all praise.”

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: Have you not heard of the stories of those who lived before you, the people of Noah, and of [the tribes of] Aad and Thamud, and of those who came after them, known only to God? A messenger came to them with all the evidence of the truth, but they covered their mouths with their hands and said, “We refuse to believe in the message with which you [claim to] have been entrusted, and we deeply suspect [the substance of] your call to us.”

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: Their messengers answered, “Can there be any doubt about God, the Originator of the heavens and the Earth? It is He who calls you so that He may forgive you some of your transgressions and lets you enjoy your life until the appointed time.” They said, “You are only mortal men like us. You want to turn us away from what our forefathers worshipped, well, then, bring us clear proof [that you are God’s Messengers].”

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: Their messengers answered, “True, we are nothing but mortal men like you, but God favors whoever of His worshipers He chooses. It is not within our power to bring you proof unless God permits it [so] let the believers place all of their trust in God.

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: How could we not place our trust in God when it is He who has shown us our ways [to enlightenment]. “We will be steadfast however much you harm us, for those who trust must place their trust in God.”

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: The unbelievers said to their messengers, ‘We will expel you from our land unless you return to our ways. But their Lord revealed to His Messengers, “We will destroy the unjust,

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: and We will let you dwell on Earth [long] after they have passed away. This is [My promise] to all who are in awe of My presence, and stand in awe of My warning.”

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: They prayed [to God for help], and each stubborn enemy of the truth failed

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: with Hell awaiting him. [There] he will be made to drink the water of most bitter distress,

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: gulping it, little by little, but hardly able to swallow it. Death will creep in on him from every side, but he will not die, for more severe suffering lies ahead of him.

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: The example of those who deny their Lord is that all their works are like ashes blown away by a fierce wind on a stormy day: they have no power over anything they have gained. This is the utmost misguidance.

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: Are not you aware that God has created the heavens and the Earth with Truth? He can, if He so wills, do away with you and bring forth a new creation:

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: That is not difficult for God.

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: All [people] will appear before God [on the Day of Judgment]; the weak will say to those who had gloried in their arrogance, “We were your followers. Can you protect us from any of God’s punishment? ” They will say, “If God had guided us, we would have guided you. It makes no difference now whether we rage or endure with patience: there is no escape for us.”

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: And when everything had been decided, Satan will say: “God promised you the Truth. I also made promises to you, but I deceived you. I had no power at all over you, but I called you, and you responded to me. Hence, do not blame me; blame yourselves. I cannot be called to your aid, nor can you come to mine. I have [always] rejected the way you associated me with God.” Grave suffering awaits all the unjust.

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who believe and have done righteous deeds will be brought into Gardens through which running waters flow, where they will remain forever with their Lord’s permission and will be welcomed with the greeting, “Peace.”

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do you not see how God compares a good word to a good tree, firmly rooted, with its branches reaching towards the heaven?

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: yielding its fruit at all times by its Lord’s permission? God gives such examples to people so that they may reflect on them.

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: The metaphor of a corrupt word is that of a rotten tree, uprooted from the face of the Earth, unable to stand.

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: God gives steadfastness to those who believe, with firm speech, both here and in the Hereafter. But He lets the unjust go astray: for God does whatever He wills.

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do you not see those who, in exchange for God’s favor, offer only ingratitude and make their people end up in the home of ruin

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: Hell, where they will roast? What an evil place to settle.

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: They claimed that there are powers that could rival God, and so they strayed from His path. Say, “Enjoy yourselves, for your destination is the Fire.”

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: Tell My worshipers who believe that they should establish prayer and give secretly and openly, out of what We provide for them as sustenance. There will come a day when there will be no bargaining and no friendship.

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is God Who has created the heavens and the Earth, and Who sends down water from the sky and brings forth fruit for your sustenance. He has made the ships useful to you so that you may sail through the sea at His command and has made the rivers beneficial to you.

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: He made the sun and the moon-- both of them constant in their courses-- useful to you and made the night and the day useful to you.

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: He has given you some of everything for which you asked Him. If you tried to count God’s blessings, you could never do it. Human beings are most persistent in wrongdoing and their rejection of the truth

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: Recall that Abraham said, “My Lord, make this land secure, and keep my children and I from ever worshipping idols-

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: because, my Lord, they have led my people astray. Hence, anyone who follows me is with me, but for anyone who disobeys me, You are surely the most forgiving, the Mercy Giver.

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: Lord, I have settled some of my children in an uncultivated valley, close to Your Sacred Sanctuary so that, oh our Lord, they might establish prayer. Make some people’s hearts drawn towards them, and provide them with sustenance, so that they may be grateful.

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: “Our Lord, You truly know all that we may hide [in our hearts], as well as all that we bring into the open: for nothing, on Earth or in heaven, remains hidden from God.

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: All praise is due to God, who has granted me, Ishmael and Isaac, in my old age. My Lord hears all prayer.

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: Lord, grant that I and some of my offspring may keep establishing prayer. “Lord, accept my supplication.

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: Grant Your forgiveness to me, and my parents, and all the believers, on the Day of Reckoning.”

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not think [Prophet] that God is unaware of what the unjust do; He only gives them respite until the Day when eyes will stare in horror.

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: They run around confusedly, with their heads up, unable to look away, their hearts a gaping void.

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: Warn people of the Day when this suffering may befall them, and when the unjust will say, “Our Lord, grant us respite for a little more time so that we might respond to Your call and follow the Messengers.” [God will say,] “Did you not swear in the past that your power would have no end?

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: You have lived in the same places as those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them, and We gave you many examples.”

46.Safi Kaskas 2024: They planned their schemes, but God was aware of their scheming, even when their plans were such as to make mountains vanish.

47.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not ever think that God will fail to fulfill His promise to His Messengers. God is Revered, and Capable of Revenge.

48.Safi Kaskas 2024: [It will be fulfilled] on the Day when the Earth is changed to other than the Earth, and the heavens too, and they all appear before God, the One, the All-Conquering.

49.Safi Kaskas 2024: For on that Day, you will see all those who force others to reject God’s messages linked together in chains

50.Safi Kaskas 2024: clothed in garments of tar, with fire veiling their faces.

51.Safi Kaskas 2024: [All will be judged on that Day] so that God may reward every soul for what it earned: God is swift in His reckoning.

52.Safi Kaskas 2024: This is a message to all people so that they will be warned and so they will know that He is One God. Let those of understanding be reminded.

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: Alif Lam Ra, these are the signs of the Book and a clear Qur’an.

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: Perhaps those who have rejected the truth will wish to submit themselves to God.

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be preoccupied with [false] hope, for they will [one day] know.

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have never destroyed a town unless it had a known decree.

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: No nation can speed up [the end of] its time, nor defer it.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [yet], they [who deny the truth] say, "You, to whom the message has been sent down, you are crazy.

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: If you are honest, why do you not bring us angels?”

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: We do not send down the angels except in Truth and, [if We did so now, those who deny the truth) would have no reprieve

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is We who sent down this Reminder , and We will preserve it.

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: We sent [messengers] before you, to earlier communities.

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: And every time a messenger came, they mocked him.

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: In that way, We insert discord into the hearts of those who force others to reject Our messages.

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: They will not believe [the Messenger]. This was what happened with those earlier people.

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [even] if We had opened a gate to the sky for them, and they had continued to ascend through it

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: they would have said, "Our eyesight has only been befuddled,” or, “We are under a spell."

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have placed constellations in the sky and have beautified it for the observers.

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We have secured it from every cursed satanic force.

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: Except for anyone who tries to eavesdrop [to learn the unknown]—he is pursued by a bright flame.

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for the Earth - We have spread it wide and set firm mountains on it and caused everything to grow in perfect balance

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We put sustenance in it for both you and all creatures for which you don’t provide.

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have the storehouse of everything that exists, and We send it down only in a known measure.

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: We send the winds to fertilize, and we bring down water from the sky for you to drink, but you can’t store it [within you].

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is We who give life and cause death, and it is We alone who will inherit all.

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: We know very well those of you who have gone ahead and those who are still to come;

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: and, behold, it is your Lord who will gather them all together [on Judgment Day]. Indeed, He is the All-Wise and the All-Knowing!

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have created man out of dried clay, formed from dark mud

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: and, before that, we created the Jinn from a scorching firestorm.

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: And when Your Lord said to the angels: "Behold, I am about to create mortal man out of dried clay, formed from dark mud

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: and when I have fully formed him and breathed into him of My Spirit , fall and prostrate [yourselves] before him!”

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then the angels prostrated themselves, all of them

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: except Iblīs. He refused to bow down with the others.

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: God said, "Iblīs! What prevents you from being among those who have prostrated themselves?"

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Iblīs] replied, "I will not bow down before a mortal man whom You have created out of dried clay, formed from dark mud!"

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: God said, "Get out of here! You are expelled from Our grace

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: and you will be cursed until the Day of Reckoning!"

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: Iblīs said, "Then, my Lord, grant me relief until the Day when all will be raised again!"

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: God answered: "You will be granted relief

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: until the Day of the appointed time."

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: [after which Iblīs] said, "Oh, my Lord! Since You led me on to this, I will make [all that is evil] on Earth appear good to people, and will most certainly entice them into sin,

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: all except the sincere among your worshipers!"

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: God said: "[Devotion] is a straight path to Me.

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: Truly, you will have no power over My worshipers except for the misled who follow you

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: and Hell is the promised meeting place for all of you.

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: There will be seven gates leading into Hell, each gate receiving its allotted share."

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: Indeed, those who are ever mindful of God will be amid Gardens and springs,

46.Safi Kaskas 2024: Enter it in peace, [safe and] secure!

47.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We will remove whatever resentment may have been [lingering] in their hearts, brethren resting on couches facing one another

48.Safi Kaskas 2024: no weariness will ever touch them there, and they will never be made to leave.

49.Safi Kaskas 2024: Tell My worshipers that I am the Forgiving, the Mercy Giver;

50.Safi Kaskas 2024: and that my punishment is painful

51.Safi Kaskas 2024: And tell them all [once again] about Abraham's guests.

52.Safi Kaskas 2024: When they entered his presence and greeted him with “Peace,” he answered, "We are afraid of you!"

53.Safi Kaskas 2024: They said: "Fear not! We bring you the good news of [the birth of] a son who will be endowed with profound knowledge."

54.Safi Kaskas 2024: Abraham said: "Do you give me this good news even though I am overwhelmed with old age? What kind of good news is this?"

55.Safi Kaskas 2024: They answered: "We have given you the good news of Truth, so do not be among those who despair!"]

56.Safi Kaskas 2024: [He exclaimed]: "And who - other than those who have utterly lost their way –could ever abandon the hope of his Lord's grace?"

57.Safi Kaskas 2024: He added: "And, heavenly messengers, what [else] might you have in mind?"

58.Safi Kaskas 2024: They answered: "We are sent to a people who already cut all relations to God and rejected his messages

59.Safi Kaskas 2024: except for Lot's household. All of them will be saved,

60.Safi Kaskas 2024: except for Lot’s wife, [God] has ordained that she should be among those who stay behind!'"

61.Safi Kaskas 2024: And when the Messengers [of God] came to the house of Lot

62.Safi Kaskas 2024: he said: "Who are you? I do not know you, people!"

63.Safi Kaskas 2024: They said, "We have come to you with what they have always rejected but wondered whether it would happen to them"

64.Safi Kaskas 2024: and we bring you certainty [of its fulfillment], for we speak the Truth."

65.Safi Kaskas 2024: Go, then with your family while it is still night, follow behind them yourself, and do not permit anyone to look back, but go where you are told to go."[15:65)

66.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We revealed unto him the decree: "The very last of those [sinners] will be wiped out by the morning."

67.Safi Kaskas 2024: The people of the town came [to Lot] hoping to have fun [with the strangers]

68.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Lot] said, "These are my guests. Do not humiliate me "

69.Safi Kaskas 2024: but fear God and do not disgrace me!" "

70.Safi Kaskas 2024: They answered, "Have we not forbidden you [to offer protection] to any kind of people?"

71.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Lot] said, "Take my daughters instead, if you must!"

72.Safi Kaskas 2024: “Do not pay attention to them [the messengers said] they are stumbling around in their wild intoxication!"

73.Safi Kaskas 2024: The blast [of Our punishment] overtook them around sunrise

74.Safi Kaskas 2024: and We turned the town upside down and rained down upon them stones of baked clay.

75.Safi Kaskas 2024: There are messages in this for those who discern.

76.Safi Kaskas 2024: [The town] is still there, standing by a road that still exists.

77.Safi Kaskas 2024: Indeed, there is a sign in this for all who believe.

78.Safi Kaskas 2024: And the woods-dwellers were also unjust,

79.Safi Kaskas 2024: and so We inflicted Our retribution on them. Both of these [sinful communities] were on a highway, [still) plain to see.

80.Safi Kaskas 2024: And the people of Al-Hijr, likewise, rejected our messengers

81.Safi Kaskas 2024: We gave them Our signs, but they turned their backs to them.

82.Safi Kaskas 2024: They carved dwellings in the mountains, thinking themselves secure

83.Safi Kaskas 2024: The blast [of Our punishment] overtook them early in the morning,

84.Safi Kaskas 2024: and all [the power] that they had acquired was of no use to them

85.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have not created heavens and Earth, and all that is between them without [an inner] truth; the Hour [when this will become clear to all] is yet to come. Hence, forgive [men's failings] gracefully.

86.Safi Kaskas 2024: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Knowing Creator of all things!

87.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We have given you seven of the oft-repeated [verses], and this glorious Qur’an

88.Safi Kaskas 2024: [so] don’t turn your eyes [longingly] towards what we have given some of them to enjoy. Neither grieve over those [who are rejecting your message], but spread your wings [of modesty and tenderness] over the believers,

89.Safi Kaskas 2024: and say, "I am the clear warner”

90.Safi Kaskas 2024: Just as We have sent down warnings for the conspiring separatists

91.Safi Kaskas 2024: who reduced the Qur’an into fragments believing in some and rejecting others

92.Safi Kaskas 2024: By your Lord! We will call them to account, one and all,

93.Safi Kaskas 2024: for whatever they have done!

94.Safi Kaskas 2024: Hence, proclaim openly all that you have been told [to say], and leave the idolaters alone.

95.Safi Kaskas 2024: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against all who mock this revelation.

96.Safi Kaskas 2024: who associate another deity with God, for in time, they will know.

97.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We know that your heart is distressed by the things they say:

98.Safi Kaskas 2024: but celebrate your Lord's limitless glory, praise Him, and be among those who prostrate themselves [before Him] in worship,

99.Safi Kaskas 2024: and worship your Lord until you die.
