1.Safi Kaskas 2024: God’s judgment is coming; do not try to hurry it. May He be exalted in His Glory! He is far above anything they associate with Him.

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: He sends down the angels with revelations by His command to whoever He may wish of His worshipers, saying, “Warn all that there is no deity other than Me. Therefore, be mindful of Me!”

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: He has created heaven and Earth in Truth. He is magnificently exalted above anything they associate with Him.

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: He created the human being out of a fertilized ovum, and suddenly he is an open adversary.

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: And He creates livestock for you to provide warmth and other benefits and to eat.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: There is beauty in them for you when you bring them home in the evenings and release them to pasture in the mornings.

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: And they carry your cargoes to places that you would be unable to reach without great difficulties. Truly, your Lord is the Compassionate, the Mercy Giver.

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: And He creates horses, mules, and donkeys for you to ride and as adornment. And He will continue to create what you do not know.

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: It rests with God alone to show you the right path. However, many will deviate from it. Had He so willed it, He would have guided you all.

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is He who sends the rains from the skies; some you drink, and from it [grows] the shrubs on which you feed your cattle

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: And He causes your crops to grow: olive trees, date-palm, grapes, and all other types of fruit. In that, there is a message for people who think.

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: He has made the night and the day subservient to you and the sun, the moon, and the stars subject to his laws. There are messages in that for people who comprehend!

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: And all the beautiful colors that He has made for you on Earth- in that, there is a message for people who consider.

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: And it is He who made the sea of benefit to you so that you may eat from it fresh and tender meat and obtain ornaments which you may wear. You see ships cleaving through it so that you may search for His abundant provision, and so you may be grateful.

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: And He has placed solid mountains on the Earth so that it does not shift with you, and rivers and pathways, so that you can find your way

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: as well as other landmarks-- for it is by the stars that men are able to find their way.

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: So, then, is He who creates like one who does not create? Will you not, then, consider?

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: If you should ever try to count God’s blessings, you could not count them, for God is the Most Forgiving, the Mercy Giver

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God knows all that you keep secret and all that you declare.

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: Now, those they call on besides God cannot create anything since they themselves are created.

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: They are, in fact, dead, not living, and they do not [even] know when they will be resurrected.

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your God is the One God, but because of their arrogance, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter refuse to admit this [truth].

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: Truly God knows all they conceal and all they declare. He does not love the arrogant.

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: And whenever [the arrogant] are asked, “What has your Lord sent down?” They say, “Ancient legends!”

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: So, on the Day of Resurrection, they will carry the full weight of their burdens as well as some of the burdens of those ignorant whom they have misled. How heavy will be the weight of their burden!

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who lived before them also schemed, and God destroyed their structure from its foundation, and the roof fell on top of them. Suffering came at them suddenly from an unexpected source.

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: On the Day of Resurrection, He will disgrace them and say, “Where are those associates, for whose sake you denied Me and became so hostile? Those who were given knowledge will say, “Truly, disgrace and desolation have come today on the unbelievers,

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: those who are wronging themselves while the angels gather them in death!” Then, the schemers will offer peace: “We did not do anything wrong!” [But they will hear an answer] “Yes, you did, because God knows well what you were doing!

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: Now enter the gates of Hell to remain there forever! How evil will be the abode of the arrogant.”

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who are mindful of God were asked, “What has your Lord sent down?” They said, “Absolute goodness.” There is good in this word for those who strived to perfect their benevolent deeds, and the next world is even better. How wonderful is the abode of those who are ever mindful of God

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: They will enter Gardens of Eden! Running waters flow, and there they will have all things they wish. This is how God will reward those who are mindful of Him.

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who are gathered in death by the angels, being good, will be greeted with “Peace be upon you! Enter paradise by what you have done”

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: Are they [the unbelievers] expecting that the angels will appear or that God’s judgment will be manifested? Those who lived before them behaved in the same way. God did not wrong them. They wronged themselves.

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: They were struck by the consequences of the evil they had done, and they were overtaken by the very thing they used to ridicule.

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: Now the very ones who associate deities with God say, “Had God willed it so, we would have worshipped Him alone, and we would never have declared anything as forbidden unless he had commanded us to do so.” This is just what those who lived before them did. Are the messengers required to do more than delivering the message?

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: We sent a messenger to every nation, saying: “Worship God, and shun the powers of evil!” Some of them were guided by God, but others deserved to be misguided. Travel around the world and see what happened eventually to those who denied the truth.

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: However eager you are for them to be guided, God does not confer his guidance on any whom He judges to have gone astray, and they will have none to help them.

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: And so they swear by God, vowing most solemnly, “God will never raise the dead to life again!” But He will, for it is a binding promise that He will fulfill, but most people do not know

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: [On that day] He will make clear to them the things they differed about, and the unbelievers will know that they were lying.

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: Whenever We wish anything to be, we simply say, “Be!” and it is.

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for those who emigrated for God’s sake after being persecuted, We will bless them with good fortune in this world, but their life in the Hereafter will be even greater if they only knew!

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: They who have been patient in hard times and placed their trust in their Lord.

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: Even before your time [Prophet], We sent only men who were inspired, and if you [those in doubt] have not yet realized this, ask the followers of earlier revelation.

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: [They brought] clear signs of the truth and books of divine wisdom. And We brought down to you this Reminder so that you may clarify to people all that has been brought down to them that they may reflect on it.

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do those who conceive evil plans feel secure that God will not cause the Earth to swallow them or that suffering will not overtake them from whence they least expect it?

46.Safi Kaskas 2024: Or that He will not take them suddenly while they are coming and going—they being unable to escape him--

47.Safi Kaskas 2024: or that He will not destroy them gradually? Your Sustainer is the Compassionate, the Mercy Giver.

48.Safi Kaskas 2024: Have they not, then, ever considered the things that God has created—how even their shadows turn right or left, prostrating themselves before God, being absolutely submissive to His will?

49.Safi Kaskas 2024: For all that is in the heavens and on Earth prostrates itself before God— every beast and the angels— without any arrogance.

50.Safi Kaskas 2024: They fear their Lord above them and do whatever they are commanded to do.

51.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God said, “Do not worship two deities. There is only One God, so it is Me that you shall revere."

52.Safi Kaskas 2024: And to Him belongs all that is in heaven and on Earth, and to Him alone be obedient, it is His right. Why, then, will you heed anyone but God?

53.Safi Kaskas 2024: For all good things come to you from God, and whenever harm comes upon you, you cry to Him for help

54.Safi Kaskas 2024: but as soon as He has relieved you of your hardship, some of you associate others with their Lord.

55.Safi Kaskas 2024: They show their ingratitude for all that We have done for them! So, go ahead, enjoy your brief life, but eventually, you will come to know [the Truth]!

56.Safi Kaskas 2024: And they allocate for the [idols] about which they know nothing, a share of what We have provided them. By God, you will be asked about your lies!

57.Safi Kaskas 2024: They also ascribe daughters to God-- May He be exalted in His glory--and they chose for themselves whatever they desire.

58.Safi Kaskas 2024: Whenever one of them is given the good news of a daughter’s birth, his face darkens, and he fills with bottled-up anger.

59.Safi Kaskas 2024: Ashamed, he avoids people because of the supposed bad news he has received, [and debates with himself] should he keeps her despite the disgrace [which he feels] or should he bury her in the ground? How dreadful is their judgment?

60.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter set the worst example, whereas God sets the highest model, for He alone is Revered and Wise!

61.Safi Kaskas 2024: Now, if God were to judge men immediately for all the evil they do on Earth, He would not leave a single living creature alive. However, He gives them relief until a time appointed by Him, but when the end of their time approaches, they can neither delay it by a single second nor can they hasten it.

62.Safi Kaskas 2024: They attribute to God what they dislike, and [all the while] their tongues utter the lie that they deserve the best. Indeed, they deserve the Fire where they will be abandoned.

63.Safi Kaskas 2024: By God, We sent messengers unto [various] nations before your time, but Satan made their deeds look good to them, so he is their master now as before, and painful punishment awaits them.

64.Safi Kaskas 2024: We sent down the Book to you, only to make clear to them the things about which they differ and as guidance and mercy to people who will believe.

65.Safi Kaskas 2024: And it is God who sends down water giving life to the Earth, even after it has been lifeless. This is a sign to those who will listen.

66.Safi Kaskas 2024: And there is a lesson for you in the grazing cattle: We give you to drink from what is in their bellies -between dung and their blood- pure milk, pleasant to those who drink it.

67.Safi Kaskas 2024: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines, you obtain intoxicants as well as good provision. In this, too, there is a sign for people who think.

68.Safi Kaskas 2024: [And consider how] your Lord has so inspired the bee [saying]: “Prepare for yourself dwellings in the mountains and trees, and in what people may build,

69.Safi Kaskas 2024: then eat all kinds of fruit, and follow humbly the paths ordained for you by your Lord.” From there, within these bees emerges a drink of many colors, healing food for man. In all, this is a sign for people who reflect!

70.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God has created you, and in time you will die, and some of you will come to an abject state in old age, ceasing to know anything that you once knew. God is All-knowing, All-Powerful!

71.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God has favored some of you in abundance over others. But those so favored will not share their wealth with those their right hands hold in trust, so [their dependents] will not be their equals. Will they, then, renounce God’s blessings?

72.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God has given you wives from among yourselves, and has given you, through your wives, children, and grandchildren, and has provided for you all of the good things of life. Will they, then, continue to believe in falsehood and reject God’s blessings?

73.Safi Kaskas 2024: And will they worship instead of God something that has no power whatsoever to provide them any sustenance from Earth or heaven and can do nothing at all?

74.Safi Kaskas 2024: So, do not propose examples of what God is. God knows, and you do not.

75.Safi Kaskas 2024: God set forth a parable [of two men]: one is a slave, unable to do anything of his own accord, and the other a [free] man to whom We have given ample wealth so that he can spend at will, both secretly and openly. Can these two be considered equal? All praise is due to God, but most people do not know.

76.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God provides another parable of two [other] men. One of them is mute, unable to do anything by himself, a burden to his caretaker. Whatever task he is directed to do, he accomplishes nothing beneficial. Can such a one be considered equal to one who commands justice [in his community] and is on the straight path?

77.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is God alone who possesses the hidden reality of the heavens and the Earth. The matter of the Last Hour will be like the twinkling of an eye, or closer still, for God has the power to will anything.

78.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God brought you out of your mothers’ wombs — knowing nothing, and He has endowed you with hearing, and sight and minds so that you might have cause to be thankful.

79.Safi Kaskas 2024: Have they not seen the birds, enabled by God to fly in mid-air, with none but God holding them aloft? In this, there are messages for people who will believe!

80.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God made your homes places to rest and enabled you to make dwellings from cattle hides—light, and easy to carry, whether you travel or camp, and [has supplied you with] furnishings and goods from the animals’ rough and soft wool and its hair [to use] for a time.

81.Safi Kaskas 2024: And, from what He has created, God has provided you with protection; [He has given you] shade [from the sun], places of refuge in the mountains, and gave you garments to protect you from the heat, as well as garments to protect you from your brutality towards each other. In this way, He perfects His blessings on you so that you may surrender yourselves to Him.

82.Safi Kaskas 2024: But if they turn away [Prophet], remember that your only responsibility is to deliver this revelation clearly.

83.Safi Kaskas 2024: They [who turn away] are fully aware of God’s grace, but they nevertheless refuse to recognize it because they are used to denying the truth.

84.Safi Kaskas 2024: The Day [of Judgment] will come when We will raise up a witness from every nation. On that day, the unbelievers will not be able to make excuses or make amends.

85.Safi Kaskas 2024: And when those who were unjust see the suffering that awaits them, they will recognize that the severity of their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they be given any relief.

86.Safi Kaskas 2024: And when those who associated other beings with God see those they associated, they will say, “Our Lord, these are our associates whom we used to call upon apart from You.” But they will throw their words back at them: “You are liars”

87.Safi Kaskas 2024: and on that Day, they will freely submit to God, and all their idols will forsake them.

88.Safi Kaskas 2024: We will heap punishment upon punishment on all the unbelievers who turned others away from God’s path in return for the corruption they caused.

89.Safi Kaskas 2024: On that Day, We will raise from within each nation a witness against them, and We will bring you [Prophet] as a witness against them. We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good news to all who would surrender themselves to God [Muslims].

90.Safi Kaskas 2024: God orders justice, beautiful excellence, and generosity to relatives, and He forbids vice, evil, and oppression. He warns you so that you will keep all this in mind.

91.Safi Kaskas 2024: Fulfill the covenant of God whenever you commit to one. Do not break your oaths once they are confirmed, and you [will] have made God your guarantor. God knows all that you do.

92.Safi Kaskas 2024: And do not be like the woman who untwisted the thread she had firmly spun just to unravel it—do not use your oaths as means to deceive one another because some of you are more powerful than others. God is testing you through all this, and on the Day of Resurrection, He will make clear to you those things about which you disagreed.

93.Safi Kaskas 2024: Had God so desired, He could surely have made you all the same nation, but He lets stray those who wish to reject His messages, and He guides rightly those who wish to be guided, and all of you will be called to account for all things you have done.

94.Safi Kaskas 2024: So do not use your oaths as a means of deceiving each other— or else your foot will slide after having been firmly in place. You will then taste the unfortunate consequences of your having turned from God’s path, and incredible suffering will await you.

95.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not exchange the covenant of God for a small price. What is with God is best for you if you only knew.

96.Safi Kaskas 2024: All that you currently have will come to an end, but that which God has is eternal. And We will most certainly grant to those who were patient their reward according to the best they ever did.

97.Safi Kaskas 2024: Whoever does good deeds, whether—man or woman—and is a believer, will live a good life and will surely receive their reward according to the best they have done.

98.Safi Kaskas 2024: When you recite the Qur’an, seek refuge with God from Satan, the rebel who is expelled from God’s mercy.

99.Safi Kaskas 2024: He has no power over those who believe and who rely on their Lord.

100.Safi Kaskas 2024: He has power only over those who ally themselves with him and those who, because of him, associate others with God.

101.Safi Kaskas 2024: And if we replace one revelation with another- and God knows best what He confers [from heaven]- they say, “You made it all up!” Truly, most of them have no understanding.

102.Safi Kaskas 2024: Tell them, “The Holy Spirit has revealed it from your Lord in Truth, so that it might strengthen the believers, providing guidance and good news to all who have surrendered themselves to God [Muslims].”

103.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We certainly know well what they are saying; “A human being is teaching him what to say.” The language of the one they allude to is a foreign one, whereas this is in clear and lucid Arabic.

104.Safi Kaskas 2024: Truly, as for those who refuse to believe God’s revelations, God does not guide them, and grievous suffering will await them.

105.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is only they who refuse to believe God’s revelations, who speak these lies, and it is they who are lying.

106.Safi Kaskas 2024: Whoever denies God after having once believed, [except for anyone who is forced to deny God while his heart remains true to his faith]- he who willingly opens up his heart to disbelief will have the wrath of God upon them and a grievous punishment awaiting them.

107.Safi Kaskas 2024: That is because they favored this worldly life over the Hereafter and because God will not guide unbelieving people

108.Safi Kaskas 2024: The ones God has sealed their hearts, ears, and eyes—it is they who are heedless.

109.Safi Kaskas 2024: No doubt they will be doomed in the life to come.

110.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for those who migrated after they were persecuted and who then struggled and persevered, to them, your Lord is the Most Forgiving, the Mercy Giver.

111.Safi Kaskas 2024: On the Day when every soul will come to plead for itself, every soul will be fully rewarded for whatever it has done, and none will be wronged.

112.Safi Kaskas 2024: And God proposes to you this parable: [Imagine, if you will,] a town that was once safe and secure, with its provisions coming to it abundantly from all places. Then it denied God’s grace. So God caused it to experience all-encompassing misery—hunger and fear as a result of what they had done.

113.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [imagine] that there had come a messenger from among them, but they denied him, so punishment overwhelmed them as they were unjust to themselves.

114.Safi Kaskas 2024: Eat of the lawful and good things that God has provided for you. And be grateful for the blessing of God if it is Him whom you worship.

115.Safi Kaskas 2024: He has only prohibited you from eating carrion, and blood, and the flesh of pigs, and that which has been dedicated to other than God, unless one is compelled to eat it out of necessity, [and then] neither desiring it nor feeding to excess. Truly God is the Most Forgiving, the Mercy Giver.

116.Safi Kaskas 2024: So, do not lie by letting your tongues wag: “This is lawful, and this is unlawful,” thereby attributing your lies to God. They who attribute their lies to God will never succeed!

117.Safi Kaskas 2024: A brief enjoyment but grievous punishment awaits them.

118.Safi Kaskas 2024: We forbade to the Jews all that We have related to you previously. We did nothing wrong to them, but they wronged themselves.

119.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then to those who sin in ignorance and afterward repent and live righteously, your Lord is the Most Forgiving, the Mercy Giver.

120.Safi Kaskas 2024: Truly, Abraham was equal to a community in himself; he was devoted to obeying God. He turned from all that is wrong—and he was not among those idolaters

121.Safi Kaskas 2024: He was grateful for the grace poured out on him by God—God had chosen him and guided him along a straight path.

122.Safi Kaskas 2024: And so We granted him favor in this world: truly, in the life to come, he will be among the righteous.

123.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We have inspired you, [Prophet]: “Follow the faith of Abraham, who turned from every false thing, and who was not among the idolaters.”

124.Safi Kaskas 2024: The Sabbath was made obligatory only on those who differed about it. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding all matters about which they differed.

125.Safi Kaskas 2024: Call people to the path of your Lord with wisdom and good advice and reason with them most courteously, for your Lord knows best who strays from His path and knows best those who are guided.

126.Safi Kaskas 2024: If you want to retaliate to an attack, make your response proportionate. But if you can be patient, it is always better to be patient.

127.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Prophet], be patient: your patience comes only from God. Do not grieve over them, nor be distressed by their schemes.

128.Safi Kaskas 2024: for, verily, God is with those who are mindful of Him and who are doers of good.

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: Limitless Glory to Him who took His servant on a night journey from the Sacred Sanctuary [Mecca] to the Farthest Mosque [Jerusalem], whose surroundings we have blessed so that We could show him some of Our signs--for truly, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We gave the Book to Moses, and We made it a guidance for the Children of Israel, [saying] “Trust yourselves to no one but Me.”

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: They are descendants from those whom we carried [in the ark] with Noah! He was [one of] Our most grateful worshipers.

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: And we warned the Children of Israel in the Book, “You will twice corrupt the Earth, and you will rise to a great height.”

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: When the first promise came true, We sent certain of Our servants against you, who were fierce in battle, and they ravaged your homes. It was a promise fulfilled.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: And as time went on, We permitted you to prevail again against them, and We helped you with wealth and children, and We made you more numerous.

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: [And we said:] “If you do good, you do it for yourselves, and if you do evil, it will be returned to you.” Then, when the final promise came, [We sent your enemies] to sadden your faces and to enter the place of worship, as they entered it the first time, and to destroy completely the structures that were the source of your pride

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your Lord may well show mercy to you. If, however, you turn back [to sinning], We will turn back [to punishing you]. And [do not forget] We have predestined that Hell will be a prison for all who reject Our promises.

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: Truly, this Qur’an shows the way of righteousness, and it brings good news to the believers who do good works that they will have a wonderful reward;

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: and We have prepared grievous punishment for those who do not believe in the life to come.

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: A human being is as hasty to pray for things that are wrong as he prays for good things. The human being is often hasty.

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have ordained night and day as two miracles. We have darkened the night and made the day visible so that you will seek to acquire abundance from your Lord and so that you may know the number of years and the count of time. We have made everything very clear.

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have tied every person’s deeds about his neck, and, on the Day of Judgment, We will bring out a book for him, which he will find spread open in front of him.

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: And it will be said, “Read your book. Today you are a witness against yourself.”

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: Whoever chooses to follow the right path, will be for the good of his soul, and whoever goes astray will [reap] his hurt, and no bearer of burdens will bear the burdens of another. We would never punish unless we had first sent a messenger.

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: But when We decide to destroy a town, We command its affluent (to follow our guidance) but they defiantly disobey; so our sentence is justly carried out, and We then destroy it utterly.

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: How many generations have We annihilated after Noah’s time! Your Lord is sufficiently aware of His worshipers’ transgressions, and All-Seeing.

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for anyone who prefers this momentary life, We readily grant whatever We will to whomever We will. Then We condemn him to the suffering of Hell, which he will have to endure, disgraced and disowned!

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: But as for those who desire the life to come, and who endeavor earnestly to obtain it, and [demonstrate] that they really believe—they are the ones who find favor [with God]. [17:19)

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: We provide all -these as well as those- from your Lord's bounties. Your Lord’s giving is never restricted.

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: Observe how We give more abundance to some than to others, but [remember that] the life to come will be blessed with higher positions and more significant favors.

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not acknowledge any other deity alongside God, lest you want to find yourself discredited and abandoned.

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your Lord has decreed that you will worship none but Him and to have excellent affection towards your parents. Should one or both of them reach old age in your care, never say anything that shows impatience with them, never rebuke them, but [always] speak to them respectfully.

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: And spread the wing of mercy in humility over to them, and say, “My Lord! Have your mercy on them, just as they [had mercy on me] when they raised me as a child”

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your Lord is fully aware of what is in your hearts. If you seek [to live] righteously, [He will forgive your errors]: He is Merciful-to-all who return to Him over and over.

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: Give what is due to your relatives, the disabled, the traveler, and do not squander your money senselessly.

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who misuse [their wealth] are [following] Satan in the same way that Satan proved to be ungrateful to his Sustainer.

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: But if you [must] turn away from the needy, while awaiting a blessing that you are hoping for from your Lord, at least speak kindly [to those in need].

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not be either tightfisted or extend yourself to the point that you cannot even provide for yourself so that you sit there blamed and impoverished.

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your Lord blesses abundantly or gives in limited portion unto whomever He wills and is able. He is fully mindful of the needs of his creatures—seeing them all.

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not kill your children out of fear of poverty. We will provide for them and you. Killing them is truly a great sin.

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: And do not go anywhere near adultery, it is immoral and a disgrace.

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: And do not kill the soul which God has forbidden—unless in the pursuit of justice. If anyone has been killed unjustly, We have given legal recourse to his heir [to claim justice], but, even then, he should not be excessive in taking life. For he is helped [by God’s law].

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: And do not approach an orphan’s property before he reaches maturity, except in the best possible way. And be true to all you have committed to do, for indeed, you will have to answer for every covenant that you have made.

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: And whenever you measure, use accurate measurements and weigh with a level balance; this will be better and would be fairer,

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: and do not take a stand on anything you do not know, (go investigate it): your hearing, sight, and heart- all will be accountable!

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not walk arrogantly about the Earth; because, truthfully, you cannot tear up the ground or make yourself as tall as mountains.

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: All of this is evil and detested in your Lord’s sight.

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: This is part of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. So, do not equate any other deity with God unless [you desire] to be thrown into Hell, self-condemned [by your actions] and rejected [by God].

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: Has your Lord chosen you to have sons while He takes daughters from among the angels? What a grave thing for you to say!

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have made things clear in this Qur’an, so [that] those [who deny the truth] might take it to heart, but it is only making them more distant from the truth

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “If there had been, as they say, other gods with Him, certainly they would have sought a way to the Lord of the Throne.”

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: May He be exalted in His glory, far above what they say in greatness and sublimity.

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: The seven heavens and the Earth, and everyone in them declares His glory. There is nothing that does not glorify Him with praise, but you humans fail to understand the manner of their glorification. He is All-Forbearing, Most-Forgiving

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: And so it is [that] whenever you recite the Qur’an, We place an invisible veil between you and those who do not believe in the life Hereafter

46.Safi Kaskas 2024: for We have veiled their hearts to prevent them from understanding the meaning, and We have made their ears deaf. So, whenever you mention your Lord alone while you are reciting the Qur’an, they turn away in disdain.

47.Safi Kaskas 2024: We know best why they listen when they listen to you, for when they are in private, these unjust people say [to one another]: “You follow only a man bewitched.”

48.Safi Kaskas 2024: See how they refer to you? They have strayed and cannot find the way!

49.Safi Kaskas 2024: And they say, “After we are but bones and dust, can we be resurrected to a new creation?”

50.Safi Kaskas 2024: Tell them: “Even if You have turned to stone or iron,

51.Safi Kaskas 2024: or any created thing, which, in your minds, is more difficult, [it is still possible]. They will say, “Who will bring us back again?” Say: “He who brought you forth the first time." And [if] they shake their heads in disbelief and ask you, “When will this happen?” Say, “It might be soon.

52.Safi Kaskas 2024: It will be the day when He calls you, and you respond by praising Him and think you have been there only a short time.”

53.Safi Kaskas 2024: Tell my worshipers to say always that which is best: truly, Satan is always ready to stir trouble among them—Satan is clearly man’s enemy.

54.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your Lord knows you best. If He wills, He will give you mercy; and if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you [Prophet] to be their protector,

55.Safi Kaskas 2024: your Lord knows best whoever is in the heavens and on Earth. We favored some of the prophets over others, and, to David, We gave the Book of Psalms.

56.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “Call on those whom you claim to be deities besides Him. They do not have any power to remove or to avert any harm from you.

57.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those to whom they pray are themselves seeking a way to approach their Lord- striving to be nearest, hoping for His mercy, and fearing His punishment for your Lord’s punishment is certainly something about which to be concerned.

58.Safi Kaskas 2024: We will destroy or chastise with severe suffering any community [if it proves sinful] before the Day of Resurrection. All of this is written in the Book.

59.Safi Kaskas 2024: Nothing has prevented Us from sending down signs, except that people in the past denied them. We gave the [community of] Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, and they sinned against it. We sent signs as a means of warning.

60.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have already told you [Muhammad] that your Lord knows all about human beings. The vision that We showed you is only a trial and temptation for men and so is the cursed tree in the Qur’an. We put Our fear in them, but this only increases their tyranny.

61.Safi Kaskas 2024: And we said to the angels, “Prostrate yourselves to Adam!” They all prostrated themselves except Iblīs, who said, “Will I prostrate myself to one whom you have created from mud?”

62.Safi Kaskas 2024: He then added, “Do You see this one that You have honored over me? If You allow me time until the Day of Resurrection, I will unquestionably lead his descendants —all but a few—by the nose to obey me!”

63.Safi Kaskas 2024: God said, “Go! But as for those who will follow you, Hell will be the repayment for you all, repayment in full!

64.Safi Kaskas 2024: Stir up those you can with your voice. Rally all your horses and men against them, and share with them their worldly treasures and children. Make all kinds of promises to them, for they will not know that which Satan promises is only an illusion.”

65.Safi Kaskas 2024: “Know that you will have no power over my worshipers; Your Lord suffices as their guardian.”

66.Safi Kaskas 2024: Your Lord is He who causes ships to move across the sea for you so that you are able to seek His blessings. Indeed He is the Mercy Giver to you.

67.Safi Kaskas 2024: And whenever you are in danger on the sea, all those you call upon vanish-except Him. But as soon as He brings you safely to shore, you turn away—for surely, man is ungrateful.

68.Safi Kaskas 2024: Can you, then, ever feel secure that He will not cause a tract of dry land to swallow you or release the deadly winds of a storm upon you, from which you will find no one to protect you?

69.Safi Kaskas 2024: Or can you even conceive of being sure that He will not make you go back to sea and then release a raging hurricane upon you that will drown you for your lack of faith? You will find no one who will support you.

70.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have honored the children of Adam, and carried them over land and sea, and provided sustenance for them out of life’s good things, and favored them to a far greater extent than most of Our creation.

71.Safi Kaskas 2024: On that Day, We will call all human beings to judgment with their book of deeds. Those who are given their book in their right hand will read their book and will not be wronged, not even by so much as a hair’s breadth.

72.Safi Kaskas 2024: For whoever [refuses to see, and so] is blind in this world, will also be blind in the life to come, and still farther away from the [straight] path.

73.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Prophet] they almost succeeded in tempting you to stray from [the Truth] that We have revealed to you and to declare something else in Our name. In that case, they would have made you their friend.

74.Safi Kaskas 2024: Had We not kept you steadfast, you would have almost begun to lean a little towards them.

75.Safi Kaskas 2024: Had this happened, We would have made you doubly punished in life and doubly punished after death. You would have found no one to support you against Us!

76.Safi Kaskas 2024: And they stirred you up enough and almost succeeded in driving you away from the land, but had they managed, they would have remained for a short time after you were gone.

77.Safi Kaskas 2024: Nothing has changed. It was this way with the messengers that We sent before you. You will find no changes in Our ways.

78.Safi Kaskas 2024: Establish prayer from the time the sun declines until the darkening of the night, and also [remember] the [Qur’an) recitation at dawn. The dawn recitation is indeed witnessed [by Us].

79.Safi Kaskas 2024: Pray during the night, an extra voluntary prayer, as it may well be that your Lord will elevate you to a praiseworthy status.

80.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “My Lord, cause me to enter [in all I do] with truth, and cause me to finish with truth, and grant me strength out of Your sustaining grace."

81.Safi Kaskas 2024: And say, “The Truth has come, and falsehood has vanished, for, falsehood is bound to vanish.

82.Safi Kaskas 2024: We send down from the Qur'an what is healing and mercy to the believers. And it only increases the unjust in their loss:

83.Safi Kaskas 2024: for, when We bless a human being, he turns away and arrogantly distances himself; and when he encounters calamity, he despairs.

84.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “Each one acts in a manner reflecting his character. Your Lord is fully aware as to who is best guided.”

85.Safi Kaskas 2024: They ask you about the spirit . Say, “Its nature is known only to my Lord, and you humans have been given but little knowledge.”

86.Safi Kaskas 2024: If We so desired, We could easily take away whatever We have revealed to you, and in that [case], you would not find anyone to plead your case with us

87.Safi Kaskas 2024: other than mercy from your Lord, His favor towards you is huge!

88.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “If all people and all Jinn would band together with the intent of generating the likes of this Qur’an, they would never be able to come out with anything like it, even if they backed each other up.

89.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have mentioned in this Qur’an every kind of example to benefit people. However, most people persist in rejecting the truth.

90.Safi Kaskas 2024: And so they say, “We will not believe you [Prophet] until you cause a spring to gush up from the Earth;

91.Safi Kaskas 2024: or unless you have a garden of dates and grapes and cause rivers to pour through it abundantly.

92.Safi Kaskas 2024: Or, until the skies fall upon us—crushing us, as you have threatened to do. Or [until] you bring God and the angels face to face before us,

93.Safi Kaskas 2024: or, to have a house of gold or you go to heaven—but we would not even believe in your ascension unless you return with a book that we can read! "Say, “May my Lord be exalted in His glory, am I other than a man appointed as a messenger?”

94.Safi Kaskas 2024: Yet nothing has prevented people from believing whenever guidance was sent to them, except for their saying, “ Has God sent a mere mortal man as His Messenger?”

95.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “If angels walked the Earth feeling at home, We would have then sent down an angel from heaven as Our Messenger.”

96.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “God is sufficient witness between you and me; truly, He is fully aware of His worshipers, and He sees all.”

97.Safi Kaskas 2024: Whoever God guides is truly guided, but for those whom God allows to stray, you will not find any protection for them apart from Him. We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection, flat on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf, with Hell as their [ultimate] dwelling; Whenever the fire subsides, We will increase it for them.

98.Safi Kaskas 2024: This will be their reward for having rejected Our signs and for having said, “After We will have become bones and dust, will we, be raised up then as a new creation?”

99.Safi Kaskas 2024: Don’t they see that God, Who created the heavens and the Earth, has the power to create another just like them and to assign a fixed term for them of which there is no doubt?” But the unjust refuse to accept anything except to reject the truth.

100.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “If you were to possess the vast storehouses of my Lord’s mercy, you would still hold on to them, fearing they run out. Man has always been tightfisted

101.Safi Kaskas 2024: We gave Moses nine apparent signs. So, ask the Children of Israel [to tell you what happened] when Moses came to them [appealing to Pharaoh on their behalf), and Pharaoh responded to him, “Truly, Moses, I think you are engaged in witchcraft.”

102.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [Moses] answered: “You know very well that no one but the Lord of heavens and Earth can produce such miracles, as evidence so that you may see. So, Pharaoh, [since you have chosen to reject what you see], I know you are utterly lost.”

103.Safi Kaskas 2024: And then Pharaoh wanted to wipe [the Children of Israel] from the face of the Earth, and We subsequently caused Pharaoh and all who joined him to drown.

104.Safi Kaskas 2024: And after that, We told the Children of Israel, “Dwell safely on Earth, but always [remember that] when the promise of the Last Day is due, We will bring you forth as [a part of] a diverse multitude.”

105.Safi Kaskas 2024: We sent down the Qur’an with the Truth, and with Truth, it has come down. We only sent you [Prophet] to bring good news and to give a warning

106.Safi Kaskas 2024: with a Qur’an which We have revealed gradually, so that you may read it to the people slowly, with reflection. We have sent it down with the actual words of God in the format that He chose.

107.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “Believe it, or do not believe it.” When it is recited to those who have been given knowledge before, they fall on their faces in prostration

108.Safi Kaskas 2024: saying, ‘May our Lord be exalted in His glory! Truly, our Lord has fulfilled His promise’

109.Safi Kaskas 2024: and they fall down, weeping. It [the Qur’an] fills them with humility”

110.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “Call on God, or call on the Merciful-to-all. By whichever name you call upon [Him], the most beautiful names are His! And pray, not loudly nor whispering, but in a moderate voice,

111.Safi Kaskas 2024: and say, “All praise be to God, who has had no son and who has no partner in His kingdom, and who needs no protector from disgrace!” And proclaim His immeasurable greatness.

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: [All] praise is [due] to God, who has sent down the Book to His servant and allowed no crookedness in it,

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: but unerringly straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good news to the believers who do righteous deeds, that they will have an excellent reward

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: where they will remain forever.

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: And to warn those who say, "God has taken a son."

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: They have no knowledge of this, nor had their forefathers. The word that comes out of their mouths is grievous; they say nothing but a lie.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then perhaps you are going to worry yourself to death chasing after them if they do not believe in this message.

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have adorned the Earth with attractive things so that We may test people [as to) who will do best

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: but We will [later] reduce all of it into a wasteland.

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: Or did you think that the fellows of the cave and [their devotion to] the scriptures were among our amazing signs?

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: The young men retreated to a cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us Your mercy and help us see our way clear out of this ordeal."

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: So, We sealed their ears in the cave for a number of years.

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then We awakened them to know which of the two groups was better able to calculate the time they had stayed there.

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: We will relate their story to you in Truth. They were young people who believed in their Lord, and We deepened their understanding.

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: We emboldened them when they stood up [to their people] and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the Earth. Never will we invoke any deity other than Him, for that would be a deplorable thing to do.

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: Our people have taken gods besides Him. Why can they not produce any clear evidence for their beliefs? Who, then, could be more unjust than someone who makes up lies about God”?

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: Now that you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship instead of God, take refuge in that cave. Your Lord will spread out His mercy for you and will help you find the best way out of your predicament.”

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [had you been present], you would have seen the sun, when it rose, veering away from their cave towards the right, and, when it set, passing away from them to the left, while they lay within an opening of that cave. This is one of God’s signs. He whom God guides is the rightly guided, but he whom God leaves to stray, you will not find for him a guiding protector.

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: And you would have thought that they were awake, whereas they were really asleep. And We turned them to the right side and to the left side while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned and run away and been very afraid of them.

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: In time We awakened them, so they may ask one another. One of them said: How long have you remained here?"" They said, ""We have been here a day or part of a day."" They said, “Your Lord knows best how long you have been here. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the town and let him find the best food and bring some back to you, but let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: If they come to know about you, they will stone you or force you to return to their religion. And then you would never succeed, ever."

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is in this way that we caused them to be found so that people would know that the promise of God is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour [of Resurrection]. As they were arguing among themselves about them, some said, “Build a structure over them. Their Lord knows best about them." But those who prevailed in the matter said: "We will build a place of worship over them."

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: Some will say there were three [sleepers], the fourth one being their dog, while others will say there were five, the sixth one being their dog - Just guessing at the unknown. Still, others will say there were seven, and the eighth one was their dog. Say, "My Lord knows their number best. Very few know [the truth] about them, so do not argue about them except in relation to what is clearly known, and do not seek the opinion of any of these people about them."

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: Never say of anything, "I will do that tomorrow"

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: without adding, "God willing." And whenever you forget, remember your Lord and say, "I pray that my Lord will guide me closer to what is right."

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years plus an additional nine.

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, "God knows best how long they remained. All that is beyond our senses, in the heavens, and on the Earth, belongs to Him. How perfectly He sees, and how perfectly He Hears! They have no protector besides Him, and He does not share His rule with anyone."

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: Recite what has been revealed to you from your Lord’s Book. No one can change His words, and you will never find any refuge except with Him.

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: And patiently stay with those who call upon their Lord morning and evening, seeking His approval. And let not your eyes turn away from them, desiring worldly attractions. Do not obey anyone whose heart We have made oblivious of Our remembrance, who follows his own whims and desires, and who abandons all that is good.

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: And say, "The Truth is from your Lord. Whoever wills - let him believe, and whoever wills - let him deny the truth." We have prepared a fire for the unjust whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass, which scalds their faces. Terrible is that drink, and evil is that resting place.

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for those who have believed and done righteous deeds - We do not let the reward – of anyone who does a good deed go to waste.

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: They will have Gardens of Eden; beneath them, rivers will flow. They will be adorned with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade and recline on couches. What an excellent reward, and what a wonderful resting place!

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: And present to them the parable of two men. To one of them, We gave two gardens of grapevines and surrounded them with palm trees, and placed fields of crops between them.

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short in anything. And We made a gushing river flow right through them.

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: And he had plenty of fruit, so he said to his neighbor while conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and greater in [numbers of] men."

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: He entered his garden and did himself harm by saying: "I do not think that this will ever perish.

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: And neither do I think that the Hour will come. But even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely get something better in return."

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: His neighbor said to him in the course of the conversation: "Have you no faith in Him who created you from dust, and then from a fertilized ovum and then shaped you into a man?

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for me, He is my Lord, and I don’t associate anyone with my Lord.

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: if only, you had said, when you entered your garden, 'It is all God’s will; there is no power except in God’? Although you see me possessing less than you in wealth and children,

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: it may well be that my Lord will give me something better than your garden and send down on it thunderbolts from the sky so that it becomes a heap of barren dust,

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: or its water sinks deep into the ground, so that you will never be able to attain it."

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [thus it happened]: his fruitful garden was surrounded [by ruin], and there he was, wringing his hands in grief over what he had spent on it while it had collapsed upon its trellises. He said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated anyone with my Lord"

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: for now there was no one other than God to help him, nor could he help himself.

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: Thus it is, all protection there belongs to God, the Truth. He gives the best reward and the best outcome.

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: Cite for them the parable of the life of this world. It is like water that We send down from the sky and is absorbed by the plants of the Earth. But in time, it becomes dry chaff, scattered by the winds. And it is God who has absolute power over all things.

46.Safi Kaskas 2024: Wealth and children are adornments of this worldly life, but the enduring good deeds produce a greater reward from your Lord and a better hope.

47.Safi Kaskas 2024: On the Day, We will set the mountains in motion, and you see the Earth emerging, and We will gather them all, leaving not a single one behind.

48.Safi Kaskas 2024: They will be lined up before your Lord, [and He will say] "You have come to Us just as We created you in the first instance. Even though you claimed that We would not make such an appointment for you."

49.Safi Kaskas 2024: And the Book [of deeds] will be laid [open], and you will see those who forced others to reject God’s messages filled with dread at what is in it, and they will say, "Alas for us! What a record is this! It leaves out no deeds, small or great, but accounts for it!" They will find everything they ever did present [before them]. Your Lord will not be unjust to anyone.

50.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [mention] when We told the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," and they all prostrated themselves, except for Iblīs. He was of the jinn, but he disobeyed his Lord’s command. Do you [seriously consider] choosing him and his descendants as allies instead of Me when they are your enemies? How despicable a bargain this is for the unjust?

51.Safi Kaskas 2024: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and Earth, nor to their own creation, and neither do I have any need to take those who lead others astray as my helpers.

52.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they [the unjust] will call on them, but they [the partners] will not respond to them, for we shall place an unbridgeable divide between them.

53.Safi Kaskas 2024: And those who forced others to reject Our messages will see the Fire, and they will know that they are bound to fall into it, and they will not find any escape from it.

54.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have mentioned in this Qur’an all kinds of examples for the benefit of people, but, more than anything else, man is argumentative!

55.Safi Kaskas 2024: Now that guidance has come to them, What could it be that is preventing people from believing or from asking their Lord for forgiveness, other than that the fate of earlier generations has not yet befallen them, or the punishment has not yet come upon them.

56.Safi Kaskas 2024: We sent Our message-bearers only to bring good news and to give warning, yet the unbelievers seek to refute the Truth with false arguments and mock My signs and warnings.

57.Safi Kaskas 2024: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of his Lord’s messages but turns away from them, forgetting what he has done? We have placed veils over their hearts, lest they understand, and deafness in their ears. If you ask them to be guided, they will never be guided.

58.Safi Kaskas 2024: Yet your Lord is the Most-Forgiving and full of mercy. Were He to take them to task for what they deserved, He would have hastened their punishment. Rather, they have an appointed time from which they will never find an escape,

59.Safi Kaskas 2024: as [was the case with] those communities that We destroyed when they did wrong: We made an appointed time for their destruction.

60.Safi Kaskas 2024: Recall when Moses said to his servant, "I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two seas, even if I must press on for years."

61.Safi Kaskas 2024: But when they reached the junction where the two seas meet, they forgot their fish, which made its way into the sea and swam away.

62.Safi Kaskas 2024: So when they had moved on, [Moses] said to his servant, "Bring us our lunch. We have certainly suffered hardship on this journey."

63.Safi Kaskas 2024: He [the servant] said, "Remember when we rested by the rock? I forgot the fish there. And it was Satan who made me forget to pay attention to it. And amazingly, it found its way into the sea.”

64.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their own footprints.

65.Safi Kaskas 2024: There, they found one of Our servants, whom We had blessed with mercy from Us, and unto whom We had imparted knowledge of our Own

66.Safi Kaskas 2024: Moses said to him, "May I follow you, so that you will teach me some of the right guidance You have been taught?"

67.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "You will not be able to wait patiently with me,

68.Safi Kaskas 2024: for how can you have patience for what you do not understand?"

69.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Moses] said, "You will find me, God willing, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] way."

70.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I mention it to you."

71.Safi Kaskas 2024: So they set out, until, when they had embarked on the ship, the man-made a hole in it. [Moses] said, "Did you knock a hole in it to drown its passengers? You have certainly done a dreadful thing."

72.Safi Kaskas 2024: The man said, “Didn’t I tell you that you would not be able to wait patiently with me?"

73.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Moses] said, "Forgive me for forgetting and don’t be too harsh with me."

74.Safi Kaskas 2024: So they set out until they met a boy whom the man killed. [Moses] said, "You killed an innocent soul who never killed anyone. You have certainly done a deplorable thing."

75.Safi Kaskas 2024: The man said, “Didn't I tell you that you would not be able to wait patiently with me?"

76.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then you should no longer let me accompany you. You have a good excuse not to put up with me."

77.Safi Kaskas 2024: So they set out until they reached the inhabitants of a town, and they asked them for food, but they refused to entertain them as guests. Then they found a wall about to collapse, so the man restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have been paid for [fixing] it."

78.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "This is where you and I will part company. I will tell you the interpretation of what you could not wait for patiently.

79.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for the ship, it belonged to disabled people working at sea. I damaged it because there was a king after them who seized every [good] ship by force.

80.Safi Kaskas 2024: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we had reasons to fear that he would cause them extreme distress by transgression and unbelief.

81.Safi Kaskas 2024: So, we wished that their Lord would give them a son better in purity and closer to mercy.

82.Safi Kaskas 2024: As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys [living] in town, and there was a treasure beneath it belonging to them. Their father was a righteous man. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and then unEarth their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. And I did not do [any of this] of my own accord. This is the interpretation of what you were not able to wait for patiently."

83.Safi Kaskas 2024: And they ask you about the Zul-Qarnayn [Two-Horned One]. Say: "I will tell you something about him."

84.Safi Kaskas 2024: We gave him power and authority on Earth, and We gave him ways to achieve anything.

85.Safi Kaskas 2024: So he chose a way

86.Safi Kaskas 2024: until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a dark, muddy spring, and nearby he found some people. We said, "O Zul-Qarnayn, either cause [them] to suffer or treat them with kindness."

87.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "We will punish the unjust. Then he will return to his Lord, and He will punish him with unspeakable suffering.

88.Safi Kaskas 2024: But as for the one who believes and does righteousness, he will have the best of rewards. We shall require him to do only easy things."

89.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then he followed a path

90.Safi Kaskas 2024: until he came to the rising of the sun. He found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no shade.

91.Safi Kaskas 2024: And so it was. Our knowledge encompassed all that happened to him.

92.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then he followed a path

93.Safi Kaskas 2024: until he reached a pass between two mountains, where he found a people who could hardly understand a word he was saying.

94.Safi Kaskas 2024: They said, "O Zul-Qarnayn, Gog, and Magog are corrupting this land. Can we pay you to erect a barrier between them and us?

95.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "What my Lord has given me is better [than any compensation]. Just give me a strong helping hand, and I will build a solid barrier between you and them.

96.Safi Kaskas 2024: Bring me chunks of iron." When he had filled in [the gap] between the two mountain-sides, he said, “Blow!” When he had made [the iron] as red hot as fire, he said, “Bring me molten copper to pour over it.”

97.Safi Kaskas 2024: So [Gog and Magog] were not able to scale the barrier nor were they able to pierce it.

98.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will crush it [the barrier]. The promise of my Lord is surely true."

99.Safi Kaskas 2024: And on that Day We will let them surge like waves over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will gather them all together.

100.Safi Kaskas 2024: On that Day We shall display Hell plainly to the unbelievers,

101.Safi Kaskas 2024: those whose eyes had been veiled from My message, and who could not hear it.

102.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do those who have denied the truth think that they can take My servants as protectors instead of Me? We have prepared Hell for the unbelievers as their lodging place.

103.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, "Shall we tell you who are the most failing in whatever they do?

104.Safi Kaskas 2024: They are those whose efforts are lost in worldly pursuits, while they think that they are doing good work.”

105.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those are the ones who deny the signs of their Lord and deny that they will meet Him. Their actions will come to nothing, and on the Day of Resurrection, they will be of no consequence.

106.Safi Kaskas 2024: Hell is their recompense for having denied the truth and ridiculed My signs and My Messengers.

107.Safi Kaskas 2024: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have Paradise for their lodging

108.Safi Kaskas 2024: where they will abide eternally, never wishing to leave.

109.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would run out long before the words of my Lord ran out, even if We were to add another sea to it."

110.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, “I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So, whoever looks forward with hope to meet his Lord let him do righteous deeds and in the worship of his Lord not associate anyone with Him."

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: Kaf Ha Ya ‘Ayn Sad.

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: Recount your Lord’s mercy on His servant Zechariah

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: When he called to His Lord silently,

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: he said, "My Lord, my bones have weakened, and my head shimmers with grey hair, but never, Lord, have I failed to be blessed in praying to you.

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: And I fear what my kinsfolk [will do] after I am gone. My wife has been barren, so give me an heir as a gift from You

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: one who will receive my inheritance, and he will be an heir to the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing to You."

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: O Zechariah, We bring you good news of a son whose name will be John, a name We have never given to anyone else before.

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, how will I have a son when my wife has been barren, and I have reached advanced old age?"

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "It will be so. Your Lord says: 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before when you were nothing.' "

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, give me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to people for three full nights."

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: So he came out from the sanctuary and signaled his people to glorify [God] in the morning and the evening

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: “John, take hold of the Book with steadfastness." And We gave him wisdom [while he was still] a boy

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: as well as affection from Us and purity, and he was always mindful of Us

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: and affectionately kind towards his parents, and he was not overbearing or rebellious.

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: [God’s] peace was upon him on the day he was born and the day of his death, and it will be upon him on the day he is raised alive.

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: Mention in the Book the story of Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: and secluded herself from them. We then sent to her Our Spirit, who appeared to her in the shape of a perfect human being.

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: She said, "I seek refuge from you in the Merciful to all, [leave me alone] if you are God-conscious."

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "I am only the Messenger of your Lord, [who says,] ‘I will give you a son endowed with purity.’"

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: She said, "How can I have a son when no man has touched me, and I have not been a promiscuous woman?"

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "It will be so. Your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to people and a mercy from Us. The matter is already determined."

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had been dead and forgotten before all this."

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: But a voice called to her from below, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided a stream beneath you.

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: Shake the trunk of the palm tree toward you; it will drop ripe, fresh dates to you.

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: So eat and drink and be satisfied and say to anyone you may see, I have made a vow of silence to the Merciful to all, and I will not talk to anyone today."

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then she went back to her people, carrying him. They said, "Mary, you have done a horrible thing.

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: Sister of Aaron, your father was not a bad man, nor was your mother a loose woman."

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: She pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to a child in the cradle?"

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Jesus] said, "I am the servant of God. He has given me the Book and made me a prophet.

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and directed me to pray and to give charitable gifts as long as I live

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: and to be affectionately kind towards my mother, and He has not made me domineering or rebellious.

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [God’s] peace was upon me the day I was born, and the day I will die, and it will be upon me the day I am raised alive."

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: Such is Jesus, the son of Mary – the Word of Truth about which they are in dispute.

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: It does not befit God to have a son; may He be exalted in His glory! When He decides on something, He simply says to it, "Be!" and it is.

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Jesus continued]: "God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then, the sects differed among themselves [concerning the nature of Jesus], so woe to those who reject the truth when they witness that awesome Day.

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: How [clearly] they will hear and see on the day they will come before Us. Today, however, they are in clear error.

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: Warn them of the Day of Regret, when everything will have been decided, and [yet], they are heedless, and they do not believe.

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is We who will inherit the Earth and all those on it, and to Us, they will be returned.

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. He was a man of truth and a prophet.

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: Father, I have received knowledge that has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: O my father, do not worship Satan. Satan was disobedient to the Merciful to all.

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: Father, I fear that a punishment from the Merciful to all will afflict you so that you will be Satan’s companion [in Hell]."

46.Safi Kaskas 2024: [His father] said, "Are you forsaking my gods, Abraham? If you do not stop this, I will surely stone you. Now get away from me and don’t come back."

47.Safi Kaskas 2024: He said, "Peace be upon you. I will ask my Lord to forgive you. He is always gracious to me

48.Safi Kaskas 2024: and I will leave you and those you call upon other than God and will call upon my Lord. Perhaps in calling on my Lord, I will be blessed."

49.Safi Kaskas 2024: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than God, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.

50.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We endowed them with Our mercy, and we made them highly honored

51.Safi Kaskas 2024: And mention in the Book, Moses. He was sincere, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

52.Safi Kaskas 2024: We called out to him from the right side of the mount, and We brought him near to Us in close communication

53.Safi Kaskas 2024: and out of Our mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron as a prophet.

54.Safi Kaskas 2024: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. He was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

55.Safi Kaskas 2024: He used to order his people to pray and to give the purifying alms, and he found favor with His Lord

56.Safi Kaskas 2024: And mention in the Book, Enoch (Idris). He was a man of truth and a prophet

57.Safi Kaskas 2024: and We raised him to a high position.

58.Safi Kaskas 2024: These are some of the prophets whom God has blessed- from among the descendants of Adam, and those We carried with Noah, and the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Merciful to all were recited to them, they fell prostrating and weeping.

59.Safi Kaskas 2024: But they were succeeded by generations who neglected prayer and pursued their desires so they will meet with utter disillusionment -

60.Safi Kaskas 2024: except for those who repent, believe, and do righteous deeds; they will enter Paradise and will not be wronged in any way.

61.Safi Kaskas 2024: [They will be in] the Gardens of Eden which the Merciful o all has promised His worshipers in a realm which is beyond the reach of human perception. His promise will be fulfilled.

62.Safi Kaskas 2024: There they will hear no ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and there, they will have their provisions, morning and evening.

63.Safi Kaskas 2024: Such is Paradise, which We give as an inheritance to those of Our worshipers who were ever mindful of God.

64.Safi Kaskas 2024: And [the angels said], "We descend only at your Lord’s command. To Him belongs what is before us and behind us and everything in between that. And your Lord is never forgetful -

65.Safi Kaskas 2024: [He is] Lord of the heavens and the Earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and persevere in His worship. Do you know of anyone equal to Him?"

66.Safi Kaskas 2024: Yet the human being continues to ask, “When I am dead, will I then be brought out alive again?"

67.Safi Kaskas 2024: Does man not remember that We created him before when he was nothing?

68.Safi Kaskas 2024: So by your Lord, We will surely round them up along with the devils, and then We will bring them round Hell on their knees.

69.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then from every sect, We will drag out those who were the most disobedient towards the Merciful to all.

70.Safi Kaskas 2024: Surely, We know best who most deserves the fire of Hell.

71.Safi Kaskas 2024: And all of you will go through it. This is a decree from your Lord that must be fulfilled.

72.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then We will save those who were mindful of God and leave the unjust on their knees.

73.Safi Kaskas 2024: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, the unbelievers say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is in the better position and enjoys superior influence?"

74.Safi Kaskas 2024: And yet, how many generations have We destroyed before them who surpassed them in possessions and [outward] appearance?

75.Safi Kaskas 2024: Say, "As for him who is lost, let the Merciful-to-all lengthen the span of his days until they see what they were promised, punishment either [in this world] or at the Hour [of Judgment]. Then they will see who is worse in possessions and who has the weaker forces."

76.Safi Kaskas 2024: To those rightly guided, God increases guidance, and the good deeds that will last are those that are deemed best and most rewarding in your Lord’s sight.

77.Safi Kaskas 2024: Have you considered the man who denies the truth of Our signs and says, "I will surely be given wealth and children.”

78.Safi Kaskas 2024: Has he received extrasensory knowledge, or has he received a pledge from the Merciful-to-all?

79.Safi Kaskas 2024: No! We will record what he says and extend the duration of his punishment.

80.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We will inherit from him the things he’s talking about, and he will come to Us alone.

81.Safi Kaskas 2024: And they have taken gods other than God, hoping that they would be [a source of] prideful strength for them.

82.Safi Kaskas 2024: No! Those deities will reject their worship and will even turn against them.

83.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do you not see that We have sent the devils to the unbelievers, inciting them to sin?

84.Safi Kaskas 2024: So do not try to expedite their punishment. We are merely counting down the number of their days.

85.Safi Kaskas 2024: On the Day [of Judgment,] We gather all the righteous as a delegation to the Merciful-to-all

86.Safi Kaskas 2024: and will drive those who forced others to reject Our messages to Hell like a thirsty herd.

87.Safi Kaskas 2024: None will have [power to] intercede on their behalf except him, who has received permission from the Merciful-to-all.

88.Safi Kaskas 2024: And they say, "The Merciful-to-all has taken [for Himself] a son."

89.Safi Kaskas 2024: You have done an outrageous thing.

90.Safi Kaskas 2024: It almost causes the heavens to rupture, the Earth to split open, and the mountains to collapse in devastation

91.Safi Kaskas 2024: that they attribute a son to the Merciful-to-all.

92.Safi Kaskas 2024: It does not befit the Merciful-to-all to take a son.

93.Safi Kaskas 2024: No one in the heavens and Earth will not come as a servant to the Merciful-to-all.

94.Safi Kaskas 2024: He has numbered them and counted them precisely

95.Safi Kaskas 2024: so that every one of them will appear alone before Him on the Day of Resurrection.

96.Safi Kaskas 2024: The Merciful-to-all will bestow His affection on those who have believed and done righteous deeds.

97.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We have made [this Qur’an] easy to recite [Prophet] so that you may give good news to the righteous and warning to stubborn people.

98.Safi Kaskas 2024: How many generations have We destroyed before them? Do you see any one of them or even hear from them even a whisper?

1.Safi Kaskas 2024: Ta Ha.

2.Safi Kaskas 2024: We have not sent the Quran down to you to distress you

3.Safi Kaskas 2024: but as a reminder to those in awe [of God].

4.Safi Kaskas 2024: A revelation from Him Who created the Earth and the highest heavens,

5.Safi Kaskas 2024: the Merciful-to-all [who is] established on The Throne of His Majesty.

6.Safi Kaskas 2024: To Him belongs everything in the heavens and the Earth, and everything between them, and everything beneath the soil.

7.Safi Kaskas 2024: Whether or not you speak aloud, He knows what is secret as well as what is [even] more hidden.

8.Safi Kaskas 2024: God, there is no god except Him. All the attributes of perfection belong to Him.

9.Safi Kaskas 2024: And has the story of Moses reached you?

10.Safi Kaskas 2024: When he saw a fire, he said to his family, “Wait here. I saw a fire; perhaps I will bring you a kindling from it, or find guidance there.”

11.Safi Kaskas 2024: But when he came to the fire, he was called, “Moses!

12.Safi Kaskas 2024: It is I your Lord, so remove your sandals. You are in the sacred valley of Tuwa ,

13.Safi Kaskas 2024: and I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed.

14.Safi Kaskas 2024: Verily, I am God. There is no god except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.

15.Safi Kaskas 2024: The Hour [of Judgment] is coming, although I have chosen to obscure it, so every soul may be recompensed according to what it strives for.

16.Safi Kaskas 2024: Do not let those who disbelieve in it, and follow their whims lead you to disbelieve in its coming, lest you perish.

17.Safi Kaskas 2024: [God added], and what is that in your right hand, Moses?”

18.Safi Kaskas 2024: “It is my staff; I lean upon it, I bring down leaves with it for my sheep, and I have other uses for it.”

19.Safi Kaskas 2024: [God] said, “Throw it down, Moses.”

20.Safi Kaskas 2024: So he threw it down, and behold- it turned into a snake, moving swiftly.

21.Safi Kaskas 2024: [God] said, “Pick it up and do not be afraid; We will return it to its former condition.

22.Safi Kaskas 2024: Now draw your hand to your side; it will come out white, unharmed - another sign-

23.Safi Kaskas 2024: so that We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.

24.Safi Kaskas 2024: Go to Pharaoh. He has transgressed all bounds.”

25.Safi Kaskas 2024: [Moses] said, “My Lord, put my heart at ease

26.Safi Kaskas 2024: and ease my task for me

27.Safi Kaskas 2024: and untie the knot from my tongue

28.Safi Kaskas 2024: so that they may understand my speech,

29.Safi Kaskas 2024: and appoint for me a minister from my family,

30.Safi Kaskas 2024: Aaron, my brother.

31.Safi Kaskas 2024: Increase my strength through him

32.Safi Kaskas 2024: and let him share my task

33.Safi Kaskas 2024: so that we may glorify You much

34.Safi Kaskas 2024: and remember You much.

35.Safi Kaskas 2024: You see and know all about us.”

36.Safi Kaskas 2024: [God] said, “You have been granted your request, Moses.

37.Safi Kaskas 2024: And We had already favored you in a previous time,

38.Safi Kaskas 2024: when We inspired your mother with this:

39.Safi Kaskas 2024: “Put him into the chest and cast it into the river. Let the river wash it to the bank, where he will be taken by an enemy of Mine and his.” And I bestowed upon you My love so that you would be brought up under My watchful eye.

40.Safi Kaskas 2024: Then your sister walked by and said, “Shall I direct you to someone who will take care of him?” We returned you to your mother so that she could rejoice and not grieve. Later, you killed someone, but We rescued you from distress but put you through other severe tests. And you remained some years among the people of Midian. Then you came [here] as I ordained, Moses.

41.Safi Kaskas 2024: And I have chosen you for Myself.

42.Safi Kaskas 2024: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not falter in remembering Me.

43.Safi Kaskas 2024: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. He has overstepped all My limits.

44.Safi Kaskas 2024: And speak to him gently that perhaps he may remember or fear [God].”

45.Safi Kaskas 2024: They said, “Our Lord, we are afraid that He will quickly do us harm or that he will overstep all boundaries.”
